quotes.quote: Our strength lies, not alone in our proving grounds and our stockpiles, but in our ideals, our goals, and their universal appeal to all men who are struggling to breathe free.
quotes.author: Adlai Stevenson

quotes.quote: Although men are accused of not knowing their own weakness, yet perhaps few know their own strength. It is in men as in soils, where sometimes there is a vein of gold which the owner knows not of.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: My strength is as the strength of ten because my heart is pure.
quotes.author: Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: None of us can hope to get anywhere without character, moral courage and the spiritual strength to accept responsibility.
quotes.author: Thomas J. Watson

quotes.quote: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: There is a comfort in the strength of love: Twill make a thing endurable, which else would overset the brain, or break the heart.
quotes.author: William Wordsworth

quotes.quote: No one can defeat us unless we first defeat ourselves.
quotes.author: Dwight Eisenhower

quotes.quote: When I've heard all I need to make a decision, I don't take a vote. I make a decision.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: It is not because things are different that we do not dare; it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A leader, once convinced that a particular course of action is the right one, must....be undaunted when the going gets tough.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers, but to be fearless in facing them. Let me not beg for the stilling of my pain, but for the heart to conquer it.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: It takes a lot of courage to show your dreams to someone else.
quotes.author: Erma Bombeck

quotes.quote: Men talk as if victory were something fortunate. Work is victory.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I would rather lose in a cause that will some day win, than win in a cause that will some day lose!
quotes.author: Woodrow T. Wilson

quotes.quote: The most dangerous moment comes with victory.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: The people who remained victorious were less like conquerors than conquered.
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.quote: Everyone who’s ever taken a shower has an idea. It's the person who gets out of the shower, dries off and does something about it who makes a difference.
quotes.author: Nolan Buhnell

quotes.quote: The softest things in the world overcome the hardest things in the world.
quotes.author: Lao-Tzu

quotes.quote: The ultimate victory in competition is derived from the inner satisfaction of knowing that you have done your best and that you have gotten the most out of what you had to give.
quotes.author: Howard Cosell

quotes.quote: The will to conquer is the first condition of victory.
quotes.author: Ferdinand Foch

quotes.quote: One may know how to gain a victory, and know not how to use it.
quotes.author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quotes.quote: Accept the challenges, so that you may feel the exhilaration of victory.
quotes.author: General George S. Patton

quotes.quote: To the girls that gave me a hard time in high school. I want to say thank you. This is a victory for all the nerds out there.
quotes.author: Amy Van Dyken

quotes.quote: Victory is a political fiction.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: If you live long enough, you'll see every victory turn into a defeat.
quotes.author: Simone de Beauvoir

quotes.quote: There are important cases in which the difference between half a heart and a whole heart makes just the difference between signal defeat and a splendid victory.
quotes.author: A.H.K. Boyd

quotes.quote: The victory of endurance born.
quotes.author: William Cullen Bryant

quotes.quote: The V sign is the symbol of the unconquerable will of the occupied territories, and a portent of the fate awaiting the Nazi tyranny.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Victory is the beautiful, bright-colored flower. Transport is the stem without which it could never have blossomed.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: . . . You ask, What is our policy? I will say; It is to wage war, by sea, land and air, with all our might and with all the strength that God can give us: to wage war against a monstrous tyranny, never surpassed in the dark lamentable catalogue of human crime. That is our policy. You ask, What is our aim? I can answer with one word: Victory - victory at all costs, victory in spite of all terror, victory, however long and hard the road may be; for without victory there is no survival.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: The courses of the Victory were absorbed into the main, then her topsails went, and then her top-gallants. She was now no more than a dead fly’s wing on a sheet of spider’s web; and even this fragment diminished. Anne could hardly bear to see the end, and yet she resolved not to flinch. The admiral’s flag sank behind the watery line, and in a minute the very trunk of the last main-mast stole away. The Victory was gone.
quotes.author: Thomas Hardy

quotes.quote: . . . He had by now divested himself of schoolboy attitudes. He was unburdened by the desire to be a martyr or a hero. Any thoughts in that direction, Belgica effectively had quashed. Heroism in the corrupt sense of the age almost by definition, meant wanton self-sacrifice and bungling. For neither had he any taste. He wanted rational attainment; victory, but not at any price. No point upon the globe was worth the cost of a single life.
quotes.author: Roland Huntford

quotes.quote: What excites and interests the looker-on at life, what the romances and the statues celebrate, and the grim civic monuments remind us of, is the everlasting battle of the powers of light with those of darkness; with heroism reduced to its bare chance, yet ever and anon snatching victory from the jaws of death.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: Our cause, then, must be intrusted to, and conducted by, its own undoubted friends, those whose hands are free, whose hearts are in the work, who do care for the result. Two years ago the Republicans of the nation mustered over thirteen hundred thousand strong. We did this under the single impulse of resistance to a common danger, with every external circumstance against us. Of strange, discordant, and even, hostile elements, we gathered from the four winds, and formed and fought the battle through, under the constant hot fire of a disciplined, proud, and pampered enemy. Did we brave all then to falter now? Now when that same enemy is wavering, dissevered, and belligerent? The result is not doubtful. We shall not fail. If we stand firm, we shall not fail. Wise councils may accelerate or mistakes delay it, but, sooner or later, the victory is sure to come.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Defeat may serve as well as victory to shake the soul and let the glory out.
quotes.author: Edwin Markham

quotes.quote: It is not enough to fight. It is the spirit which we bring to the fight that decides the issue. It is morale that wins the victory.
quotes.author: General George Marshall

quotes.quote: It is the fight alone that pleases us, not the victory.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the grey twilight that knows not victory nor defeat.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: There is only one success - to spend your life in your own way.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: I am still determined to be cheerful and happy, in whatever situation I may be; for I have also learned from experience that the greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances.
quotes.author: Martha Washington

quotes.quote: Don’t limit investing to the financial world. Invest something of yourself, and you will be richly rewarded.
quotes.author: Charles Schwab

quotes.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy too. He who has courage and faith will never perish in misery.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: I'm so optimistic I'd go after Moby Dick in a row boat and take the tartar sauce with me.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: In seeking happiness for others, you find it for yourself.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
quotes.author: Franklin Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The secret of happiness is not in doing what one likes, but in liking what one does.
quotes.author: James M. Barrie

quotes.quote: Be happy while you’re living, for you’re a long time dead.
quotes.author: Scottish Proverb

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a matter of good fortune or worldly possessions. It's a mental attitude. It comes from appreciating what we have, instead of being miserable about what we don't have. It's so simple, yet so hard for the human mind to comprehend.
quotes.author: Bits and Pieces

quotes.quote: Happiness lies in our own backyard, but It's probably well hidden by crabgrass.
quotes.author: Dell Crossword Puzzles

quotes.quote: If I keep a green bough in my heart, the singing bird will come.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing. If you want happiness for a year, inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime, help someone else.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: True happiness consists in making happy.
quotes.author: Bharavi's Kiratarjuniya, Hindu

quotes.quote: This planet has or rather had a problem, which was this: most of the people living on it were unhappy for pretty much of the time. Many solutions were suggested for this problem, but most of these were largely concerned with the movements of small green pieces of paper, which is odd because on the whole it was not the small pieces of paper that were unhappy.
quotes.author: Douglas Noel Adams

quotes.quote: Most of us would be upset if we were accused of being "silly" comes from the old English word "seilig" and it's literal definition is "to be blessed , happy, healthy and prosperous.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: If men would consider not so much wherein they differ, as wherein they agree, there would be far less of uncharitableness and angry feeling in the world.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: The person who has a firm trust in the Supreme Being is powerful in his power, wise by his wisdom, happy by his happiness.
quotes.author: Joseph Addison

quotes.quote: Pleasure is not happiness. It has no more importance than a shadow following a man.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: To love is to suffer. To avoid suffering one must not love. But then one suffers from not loving. Therefore, to love is to suffer; not to love is to suffer; to suffer is to suffer. To be happy is to love. To be happy, then, is to suffer, but suffering makes one unhappy. Therefore, to be happy one must love or love to suffer or suffer from too much happiness.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: We must dare to be happy, and dare to confess it, regarding ourselves always as the depositories, not as the authors of our own joy.
quotes.author: Henri Frediric Amiel

quotes.quote: Happiness, it is said, is seldom found by those who seek it, and never by those who seek it for themselves.
quotes.author: F. Emerson Andrews

quotes.quote: All I ask for is an opportunity to prove that money doesn't buy happiness.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: All the happiness you ever find lies in you.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: An endurance test for some people is the pursuit of happiness.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: For every minute you are angry, you lose 60 seconds of happiness.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The chief cause of failure and unhappiness is trading what you want the most for what you want now.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: Gather the crumbs of happiness and they will make you a loaf of contentment.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness consists in activity; such as the constitution of our nature; it is a running stream, and not a stagnant pool.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is acceptance.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is like a butterfly. The more you chase it, the more it eludes you. But if you turn your attention to other things, It comes and sits softly on your shoulder.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Happiness is like jam. You can't spread even a little without getting some on yourself.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is made to be shared.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is not always measured in smiles.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is not pleasure, it's victory.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is often the result of being too busy to be miserable.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happiness is the art of never holding in your mind the memory of any unpleasant thing that has passed.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Be helpful. When you see a person without a smile, give him yours.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: He alone is the happy man who has learned to extract happiness not from ideal conditions but from actual ones about him.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: He who has not learned to share his blessings with others has not found the true path to enduring happiness. HAPPINESS comes from sharing one's self and one's blessings. All riches are multiplied by the simple process of sharing them where they may serve others.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Money can't buy happiness, but it does quiet the nerves.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Money can't buy happiness; it can, however, rent it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Much happiness is overlooked because it doesn’t cost anything.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: No one can secure happiness without earning it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Security is a thumb and a blanket. Happiness is a warm puppy.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Some people cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Sometimes we miss happiness by looking too far for things nearby.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Stop searching. Happiness is right next to you.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The supreme happiness to life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: When people yearn with all their hearts For just one treasure far away; They close their eyes to countless joys That crowd around them every day.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: You have to find happiness in yourself before you can find it with someone.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Most people would rather be certain they’re miserable, than risk being happy.
quotes.author: Dr. Robert Anthony

quotes.quote: Happiness is a state of activity.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: . . . happiness is the highest good, being a realization and perfect practice of virtue, which some can attain, while others have little or none of it. . . .
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: If happiness is activity in accordance with excellence, it is reasonable that it should be in accordance with the highest excellence.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.
quotes.author: Mildred Barthel

quotes.quote: Happy the man who, like Ulysses, has made a fine voyage, or has won the Golden Fleece, and then returns, experienced and knowledgeable, to spend the rest of his life among his family!
quotes.author: Joachim Du Bellay

quotes.quote: Happiness is like a cat, If you try to coax it or call it, it will avoid you; it will never come. But if you pay not attention to it and go about your business, you'll find it rubbing against your legs and jumping into your lap.
quotes.author: William John Bennett

quotes.quote: I remember hearing in a talk that the more we express our gratitude to God for our blessings, the more he will bring to our mind other blessings. The more we are aware of to be grateful for, the happier we become.
quotes.author: Ezra Taft Benson

quotes.quote: The lives and happiness of our children, as far ahead as the mind can reach, depend on us today. If we succeed, posterity looking back will record that this was indeed man's finest hour.
quotes.author: Carl A. Berendsen

quotes.quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
quotes.author: Ingrid Bergman

quotes.quote: Don't mistake pleasure for happiness. They are a different breed of dogs.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
quotes.author: Lady Marguerite Blessington

quotes.quote: You can make yourself happy or miserable, it's the same amount of effort.
quotes.author: Ray Bradbury

quotes.quote: Set peace of mind as your highest goal and organize your entire life around it .
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.quote: The secret of happiness is to admire without desiring.
quotes.author: Francis Herbert Bradley

quotes.quote: Happiness quite unshared can scarcely be called happiness; it has no taste.
quotes.author: Charlotte Bronte

quotes.quote: One of the keys to happiness is a bad memory.
quotes.author: Ritz Mae Brown

quotes.quote: People take different roads seeking fulfillment and happiness. Just because they're not on your road doesn't mean they've gotten lost.
quotes.author: H.Jackson Browne

quotes.quote: There may be Peace without Joy, and Joy without Peace, but the two combined make Happiness.
quotes.author: Sir John Buchan

quotes.quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: What is the best thing for a stream? It is to keep moving. If it stops, it stagnates. So the best thing for a man is that which keeps the currents going - the physical, the moral, and the intellectual currents. Hence the secret of happiness is something to do; some congenial work. Take away the occupation of all men, and what a wretched world it would be! Few persons realize how much of their happiness is dependent upon their work, upon the fact that they are kept busy and not left to feed upon themselves. Happiness comes most to persons who seek her least, and think least about it. It is not an object to be sought; it is a state to be induced. It must follow and not lead. It must overtake you, and not you overtake it. How important is health to happiness, yet the best promoter of health is something to do. Blessed is the man who has some congenial work, some occupation in which he can put his heart, and which affords a complete outlet to all the forces there are in him.
quotes.author: John Burroughs

quotes.quote: What is the worth of anything, But for the happiness 'twill bring?
quotes.author: Richard Owen Cambridge

quotes.quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: I enjoyed my own nature to the fullest, and we all know that there lies happiness, although, to soothe one another mutually, we occasionally pretend to condemn such joys as selfishness.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Your successes and happiness are forgiven you only if you generously consent to share them.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Remember happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have; it depends solely on what you think.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: Success is getting what you want; happiness is wanting what you get.
quotes.author: Dale Carnegie

quotes.quote: If money is all that a man makes, then he will be poor - poor in happiness, poor in all that makes life worth living.
quotes.author: Herbert N. Casson

quotes.quote: He who sings frightens away his ills.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: The office of government is not to confer happiness, but to give men the opportunity to work out happiness for themselves.
quotes.author: William Emery Channing

quotes.quote: To be happy, one must rid oneself of prejudice, be virtuous, healthy, and have a capacity for enjoyment and for passion ...
quotes.author: Madam du Chetelet

quotes.quote: Anybody who is happy all the time needs a psychiatrist.
quotes.author: David A. Christensen

quotes.quote: I do not understand what the man who is happy wants in order to be happier.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: In our daily lives, we must see That it is not happiness that makes us grateful, But the gratefulness that makes us happy.
quotes.author: Albert Clarke

quotes.quote: Happiness is a stock that doubles in a year.
quotes.author: Ira U. Cobleigh

quotes.quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or smile, a kind look, a heartfelt compliment, and the countless infinitesimals of pleasurable and genial feeling.
quotes.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quotes.quote: We never enjoy perfect happiness; our most fortunate successes are mingled with sadness; some anxieties always perplex the reality of our satisfaction.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille

quotes.quote: If solid happiness we prize, Within our breast this jewel lies, And they are fools who roam. The world has nothing to bestow; From our own selves our joys must flow, And that dear hut, our home.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Cotton

quotes.quote: Happiness depends, as Nature shows, Less on exterior things than most suppose.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.quote: We begin from the recognition that all beings cherish happiness and do not want suffering. It then becomes both morally wrong and pragmatically unwise to pursue only one's own happiness oblivious to the feelings and aspirations of all others who surround us as members of the same human family. The wiser course is to think of others when pursuing our own happiness.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Happiness is always a byproduct. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.
quotes.author: Robert Davies

quotes.quote: To find out what one is fitted to do and to secure an opportunity to do it is the key to happiness.
quotes.author: John Dewey

quotes.quote: Happiness is not given but exchanged.
quotes.author: Diane

quotes.quote: The envious are not happy unless they are making other people envious.
quotes.author: Diane

quotes.quote: A happy person is not a person in a certain set of circumstances, but rather a person with a certain set of attitudes.
quotes.author: Hugh Downs

quotes.quote: The gift of happiness belongs to those who unwrap it.
quotes.author: Andrew Dunbar

quotes.quote: The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts.
quotes.author: Timothy Dwight

quotes.quote: I have never belonged wholeheartedly to a country, a state, nor to a circle of friends, nor even to my own family. When I was still a rather precocious young man, I already realized most vividly the futility of the hopes and aspirations that most men pursue throughout their lives. Well-being and happiness never appeared to me as an absolute aim. I am even inclined to compare such moral aims to the ambitions of a pig.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Be unselfish. That is the first and final commandment for those who would be useful and happy in their usefulness. If you think of yourself only you cannot develop because you are choking the source of development, which is spiritual expansion through thought for others.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: For every minute you are angry, you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Of cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more of it remains.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: If thou wilt make a man happy, add not unto his riches but take away from his desires.
quotes.author: Epicurus

quotes.quote: It is the chiefest point of happiness that a man is willing to be what he is.
quotes.author: Desiderius Erasmus

quotes.quote: Account no man happy till he dies.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: Ten Spiritual Tonics 1. Stop worrying. Worry kills life. 2. Begin each day with a prayer. It will arm your soul. 3. Control appetite. Over-indulgence clogs body and mind. 4. Accept your limitations . . . 5. Don’t envy. It wastes time and energy. 6. Have faith in people. Cynicism sours the disposition. 7. Find a hobby. It will relax your nerves. 8. Read a book a week to stimulate imagination and broaden your views. 9. Spend some time alone for the peace of solitude and silence. 10. Try to want what you have, instead of spending your strength trying to get what you want.
quotes.author: Abraham L. Feinberg

quotes.quote: It is not by accident that the happiest people are those who make a conscious effort to live useful lives. Their happiness, of course, is not a shallow exhilaration where life is one continuous intoxicating party. Rather, their happiness is a deep sense of inner peace that comes when they believe their lives have meaning and that they are making a difference for good in the world.
quotes.author: Ernest A. Fitzgerald

quotes.quote: To be stupid, selfish, and have good health are three requirements for happiness, though if stupidity is lacking, all is lost.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: How would you know what happy is if you've never been otherwise.
quotes.author: Malcolm S. Forbes

quotes.quote: There is joy in work. All that money can do is buy us some one else's work in exchange for our own. There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: A person is never happy except at the price of some ignorance.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Happiness consists more in small conveniences of pleasures that occur every day, than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom to a man in the course of his life.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Human felicity is produced not so much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen, as by little advantages that occur every day.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: The U.S. Constitution doesn't guarantee happiness, only the pursuit of it. You have to catch up with it yourself.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: What is without us has no connection with happiness, only so far as the preservation of our lives and health depends upon it. . . . Happiness springs immediately from the mind.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Not every age allows its sons to reap the results which remain great for all time, and . . . not every century is fitted to make the men who live in it distinguished and happy.
quotes.author: Gustave Freytag

quotes.quote: Happiness is a man’s greatest achievement; it is the response of his total personality to a productive orientation toward himself and the world outside.
quotes.author: Erich Fromm

quotes.quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
quotes.author: Robert Lee Frost

quotes.quote: He is happy that knoweth not himself to be otherwise
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: No man can be happy without a friend, nor be sure of his friend until he is unhappy.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: Happiness is a myth we seek, If manifested surely irks; Like river speeding to the plain, On its arrival slows and murks. For man is happy only in His aspiration to the heights; When he attains his goal, he cools And longs for other distant flights.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: If you would find happiness and joy, lose your life in some noble cause. A worthy purpose must be at the center of every worthy life.
quotes.author: Jack H. Goaslind, Jr.

quotes.quote: Striving for happiness is a long, hard journey with many challenges. It requires eternal vigilance to win the victory. You cannot succeed with sporadic little flashes of effort. Constant and valiant living is necessary.
quotes.author: Jack H. Goaslind, Jr.

quotes.quote: A person is never happy till their vague strivings has itself marked out its proper limitations.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Each has his own happiness in his hands, as the artist handles the rude clay he seeks to reshape it into a figure; yet it is the same with this art as with all others: only the capacity for it is innate; the art itself must be learned and painstakingly practiced.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Nine keys to contentment Health enough to make work a pleasure.Wealth enough to support your needs.Strength enough to battle with difficulties and overcome them. Grace enough to confess your sins and forsake them. Patience enough to toil until some good is accomplished.Charity enough to see some good in your neighbors. Love enough to move you to be useful and helpful to others.Faith enough to make real things of God. Hope enough to remove all anxious fears concerning the future.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe

quotes.quote: The highest happiness of man . . . is to have probed what is knowable and quietly to revere what is unknowable.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: What makes people happy is activity; changing evil itself into good by power, working in a God like manner.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Whatever mitigates the woes, or increases the happiness of others, is a just criterion of goodness; and whatever injures society at large, or any individual in it, is a criterion of iniquity.
quotes.author: Oliver Goldsmith

quotes.quote: It is one of the strange ironies of this strange life that those who work the hardest, who subject themselves to the strictest discipline, who give up certain pleasurable things in order to achieve a goal, are the happiest men. When you see 20 or 30 men line up for a distance race in some meet, don't pity them, don't feel sorry for them. Better envy them instead.
quotes.author: Brutus Hamilton

quotes.quote: Family life is the source of the greatest human happiness. This happiness is the simplest and least costly kind, and it cannot be purchased with money. But it can be increased if we do two things: if we recognize and uphold the essential values of family life and if we get and keep control of the process of social change so as to make it give us what is needed to make family life perform its essential functions.
quotes.author: Robert J. Havighurst

quotes.quote: Happiness, in this world, if it comes at all, comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit, and it leads us on a wild-goose chase, and it is never attained.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: Happiness is as a butterfly, which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, my alight upon you.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: So I have loitered my life away, reading books, looking at pictures, going to plays, hearing, thinking, writing on what pleased me best. I have wanted only one thing to make me happy, but wanting that have wanted everything.
quotes.author: William Hazlitt

quotes.quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
quotes.author: Ermest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a destination. It is a method of life.
quotes.author: Burton Hills

quotes.quote: Happiness doesn’t depend on what we have, but it does depend on how we feel towards what we have. We can be happy with little and miserable with much.
quotes.author: W. D. Hoard

quotes.quote: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Natural joy brings no headaches and no heartaches.
quotes.author: Elbert Green Hubbard

quotes.quote: Whoever said money can't buy happiness didn't know where to shop.
quotes.author: Gittel Hudnick

quotes.quote: Life’s greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
quotes.author: Victor Marie Hugo

quotes.quote: The greatest happiness of life it the conviction that we are loved - loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
quotes.author: Victor Marie Hugo

quotes.quote: That action is best which procures the greatest happiness for the greatest numbers.
quotes.author: Francis Hutcheson

quotes.quote: Money may be the husk of many things, but not the kernel. It brings you food, but not appetite; medicine, but not health; acquaintances, but not friends; servants, but not faithfulness; days of joy, but not peace or happiness.
quotes.author: Henrik Ibsen

quotes.quote: The happiest people seem to be those who have no particular reason for being happy except that they are so.
quotes.author: Dr. David Ralph Inge

quotes.quote: Happiness is not a reward - it is a consequence. Suffering is not a punishment, it is a result.
quotes.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quotes.quote: True happiness, we are told, consists in getting out of one's self, but the point is not only to get out, you must stay out; and to stay out you must have some absorbing errand.
quotes.author: Henry James Jr.

quotes.quote: Happiness comes of the capacity to feel deeply, to enjoy simply, to think freely, to risk life, to be needed.
quotes.author: Storm Jameson

quotes.quote: It is neither wealth nor splendor, but tranquility and occupation, which give happiness.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
quotes.author: Douglas Jerrold

quotes.quote: Labor, if it were not necessary for existence, would be indispensable for the happiness of man.
quotes.author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: That all who are happy are equally happy is not true. A peasant and a philosopher may be equally satisfied, but not equally happy. A small drinking glass and a large one may be equally full, but the large one holds more than the small.
quotes.author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: There is nothing which has yet been contrived by man by which so much happiness is produced as by a good tavern or inn.
quotes.author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: When once a man has made celebrity necessary to his happiness, he has put it in the power of the weakest and most timorous malignity, if not to take away his satisfaction, at least to withhold it. His enemies may indulge their pride by airy negligence and gratify their malice by quiet neutrality.
quotes.author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: True happiness Consists not in the multitude of friends But in the worth and choice.
quotes.author: Ben Johnson

quotes.quote: True happiness consists not in the multitude of friends, but in their worth and choice.
quotes.author: Ben Johnson

quotes.quote: Happiness is the soul's joy in the possession of the intangible.
quotes.author: William George Jordan

quotes.quote: True happiness must have the tinge of sorrow outlived, the sense of pain softened by the mellowing years, the chastening of loss that in the wondrous mystery of time transmutes our suffering into love and sympathy with others.
quotes.author: William George Jordan

quotes.quote: Unhappiness is the hunger to get; happiness is the hunger to give. . . . If the individual should set out for a single day to give happiness, to make life happier, brighter and sweeter, not for himself but for others, he would find a wondrous revelation of what happiness really is.
quotes.author: William George Jordan

quotes.quote: It is not necessary that whilst I live I live happily; but it is necessary that so long as I live I should live honorably.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.quote: How simple and frugal a thing is happiness: a glass of wine, a roast chestnut, a wretched little brazier, the sound of the sea. . . . All that is required to feel that here and now is happiness is a simple, frugal heart.
quotes.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quotes.quote: Knowledge is happiness, because to have knowledge - broad deep knowledge - is to know true ends from false, and lofty things from low. To know the thoughts and deeds that have marked man’s progress is to feel the great heart-throbs of humanity through the centuries; and if one does not feel in these pulsations a heavenward striving, one must indeed be deaf to the harmonies of life.
quotes.author: Helen Adams Keller

quotes.quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
quotes.author: Helen Adams Keller

quotes.quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which as been opened for us.
quotes.author: Helen Adams Keller

quotes.quote: Definition of happiness: The full use of your powers along lines of excellence.
quotes.author: John Fitzgerald Kennedy

quotes.quote: Do it this very moment! Don’t put it off, don’t wait! There’s no use in doing a kindness If you do it a day too late.
quotes.author: Charles Kingsley

quotes.quote: Happiness and misery depend as much on temperament as on fortune.
quotes.author: Francois Duc de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: One is never so happy or so unhappy as one thinks.
quotes.author: Francois Duc de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: We are more interested in making others believe we are happy than in trying to be happy ourselves.
quotes.author: Francois Du de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: We are never so happy, nor so unhappy, as we suppose ourselves to be.
quotes.author: Francois Duc de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: Were it not better to forgetThan to remember and regret
quotes.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quotes.quote: Happiness is something that comes into our lives through doors we don't even remember leaving open.
quotes.author: Rose Lane

quotes.quote: The world is full of people looking for spectacular happiness while they snub contentment.
quotes.author: Doug Larson

quotes.quote: Science has promised us truth. It has never promised us either peace or happiness.
quotes.author: Gustave Le Bon

quotes.quote: Happiness isn't something you experience, it's something you remember.
quotes.author: Oscar LeVant

quotes.quote: We meet this evening, not in sorrow, but in gladness of heart.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: For happiness one needs security, but joy can spring like a flower even from the cliffs of despair.
quotes.author: Ann Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.quote: The day is cold, and dark, and dreary; It rains, and the wind is never weary; The vine still clings to the mouldering wall, But at every gust the dead leaves fall, And the day is dark and dreary. My life is cold, and dark, and dreary; It rains, and the wind is never weary; My thoughts still cling to the mouldering Past But the hopes of youth fall thick in the blast, And the days are dark and dreary. Be still, sad heart! and cease repining; Behind the clouds is the sun still shining; Thy fate is the common fate of all: Into each life some rain must fall; Some days must be dark and dreary.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: In vain do they talk of happiness who never subdued an impulse in obedience to a principle. He who never sacrificed a present to a future good, or a personal to a general one, can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
quotes.author: Horace Mann

quotes.quote: Talk happiness. The world is sad enough without your woe.
quotes.author: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.quote: Experience praises the most happy is the one who made the most people happy.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: Friends, books, cheerful heart, and conscience clear are the most choice companions we have here.
quotes.author: William Mather

quotes.quote: The way to happiness: keep your heart free from hate, your mind from worry. Live simply, expect little, give much. Fill your life with love. Scatter sunshine. Forget self, think of others. Do as you would be done by. Try this for a week and you will be surprised.
quotes.author: H. C. Mattern

quotes.quote: The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past.
quotes.author: Andre Maurois

quotes.quote: The greedy search for money or success will almost always lead men into unhappiness. Why? Because that kind of life makes them depend upon things outside themselves.
quotes.author: Andre Maurois

quotes.quote: I see nothing wrong with the human trait to desire. In fact, I consider it integral to our success mechanism. Becoming attached to what we desire is what causes the trouble. If you must have it in order to be happy, then you are denying the happiness of the here and now.
quotes.author: Peter McWilliams

quotes.quote: One of the great joys of life is creativity. Information goes in, gets shuffled about, and comes out in new and interesting ways.
quotes.author: Peter McWilliams

quotes.quote: Happiness is like a kiss. You must share it to enjoy it.
quotes.author: Bernard Melzer

quotes.quote: Success is getting and achieving what you want. Happiness is wanting and being content with what you get.
quotes.author: Bernard Meltzer

quotes.quote: Happiness is the china shop; love is the bull.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Ask yourself whether you are happy, and you cease to be so.
quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

quotes.quote: I have learned to seek my happiness by limiting my desires, rather than in attempting to satisfy them.
quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

quotes.quote: Then wilt thou not be loath To leave this Paradise, but shalt possess A Paradise within thee, happier far.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: If you find some happiness inside yourself, you'll start findin' it in lot of other places too.
quotes.author: Gladiola Montana

quotes.quote: I believe the recipe for happiness to be just enough money to pay the monthly bills you acquire, a little surplus to give you confidence, a little too much work each day, enthusiasm for your work, a substantial share of good health, a couple of real friends, and a wife and children to share life's beauty with you.
quotes.author: J. Kenfield Morley

quotes.quote: Happiness comes when you believe in what you are doing, know what you are doing, and love what you are doing.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.quote: Where, then, does happiness lie? In forgetfulness, not indulgence, of the self. In escape from sensual appetites, not in their satisfaction. We live in a dark, self-enclosed prison, which is all we see or know if our glance is fixed ever downward. To lift it upward, becoming aware of the wide, luminous universe outside, this alone is happiness. At its highest level, such happiness is the ecstasy that mystics have inadequately described. At more humdrum levels, it is human love; the delights and beauties of our dear earth, its colors and shapes and sounds; the enchantment of understanding and laughing, and all other exercise of such faculties as we possess; the marvel of the meaning of everything, fitfully glimpsed, inadequately expounded, but ever present.
quotes.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quotes.quote: Happiness is a matter of one's most ordinary and everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self.
quotes.author: Jean Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: There is only one way to achieve happiness on this terrestrial ball, And that is to have either a clear conscience or none at all.
quotes.author: Ogden Nash

quotes.quote: Nobody really cares if you're miserable, so you might as well be happy.
quotes.author: Cythina Nelms

quotes.quote: If this world afford true happiness, it is to be found in a home where love and confidence increase with the years, where the necessities of life come without severe strain, where luxuries enter only after their cost has been carefully considered.
quotes.author: Alfred Edward Newton

quotes.quote: If what Proust says is true, that happiness is the absence of fever, then I will never know happiness. For I am possessed by a fever for knowledge, experience, and creation.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: It is necessary to the happiness of a man that he be mentally faithful to himself.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: All men have happiness as their object: there is no exception. However different the means they employ, they all aim at the same end.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: The belief that youth is the happiest time of life is founded on fallacy. The happiest person is the person who thinks the most interesting thoughts, and we grow happier as we grow older.
quotes.author: William Lyon Phelps

quotes.quote: The principle of happiness should be like the principle of virtue: it should not be dependent of things, but be a part of personality [and character].
quotes.author: William Lyon Phelps

quotes.quote: Said Scopas of Thessaly, "We rich men count our felicity and happiness to lie in these superfluities, and not in those necessary things."
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: That state of life is most happy where superfluities are not required and necessities are not wanting.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: The man who first brought ruin upon the Roman people was he who pampered them by largesses and amusements.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: Happiness is a way station between too much and too little.
quotes.author: Channing Pollock

quotes.quote: It is in the compelling zest of high adventure and of victory, and in creative action, that man finds his supreme joys.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts....take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Happy people plan actions, they don't plan results.
quotes.author: Dennis Waitley

quotes.quote: Dreams are extremely important. You can’t do it unless you imagine it.
quotes.author: George Lucas

quotes.quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further then a great idea that inspires no one.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.quote: It's the independent American spirit that built this country - hard-working entrepreneurs who believe in the reality of their dreams.
quotes.author: Robert E. Hughes

quotes.quote: It was the man's dream, and his inspiring attempt to make them come true that remain important.
quotes.author: Francis Ford Coppola

quotes.quote: We must never surrender. America will get better and better. Keep hope alive. Keep hope alive.
quotes.author: Jesse Jackson

quotes.quote: We were always dreaming of how it was going to be.
quotes.author: George Lucas

quotes.quote: I don't dream at night, I dream all day; I dream for a living.
quotes.author: Steven Spielberg

quotes.quote: A civilization is as great as its dreams, and its dreams are dreamt by artists.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Follow your heart and your dreams will come true.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Happy are those who dream dreams and are willing to pay the price to make them come true.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Keep your heart open to dreams. For as long as there's a dream, there is hope, and as long as there is hope, there is joy in living.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: No dream comes true until you wake up and go to work.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: No dreamer is ever too small; no dream is ever too big.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The key to happiness is having dreams. The key to success is making your dreams come true.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The world is full of Kings and Queens, who blind your eyes and steal your dreams.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: We mustn't let our passions destroy our dreams.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Wind to thy wings. Light to thy path. Dreams to thy heart.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Yesterday is but a vision, and tomorrow is only a dream. But today well lived makes every yesterday a dream of happiness, and every tomorrow a dream of hope.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: You'll never achieve your dreams if they don't become goals.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Your dreams come true when you act to turn them into realities.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Make no little plans, they have no magic to stir men's blood and will not be realized. Make big plans; aim high in hope and work, remembering that a noble and logical plan never dies, but long after we are gone will be a living thing.
quotes.author: Lita Bane

quotes.quote: Vision without action is merely a dream. Action without vision just passes the time. Vision with action can change the world.
quotes.author: Joel Barker

quotes.quote: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
quotes.author: John Barrymore

quotes.quote: Dreaming men are haunted men.
quotes.author: Stephen Vincent Binet

quotes.quote: Dreams have but one owner at a time. That is why dreamers are lonely.
quotes.author: Erma Bombeck

quotes.quote: Dreams that do come true can be as unsettling as those that don't.
quotes.author: Brett Butler

quotes.quote: When your heart is in your dreams, no request is too extreme.
quotes.author: Jiminy Cricket

quotes.quote: Dreaming permits each of and every one of us to be quietly and safely insane every night of our lives.
quotes.author: William Dement

quotes.quote: The end of wisdom is to dream high enough to lose the dream in the seeking of it.
quotes.author: William Faulkner

quotes.quote: Dream no small dreams for they have no power to move the hearts of men.
quotes.author: Goethe

quotes.quote: Cherish your visions and you dreams, as they are the children of your soul; the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: Man, alone, has the power to transform his thoughts into physical reality; man, alone, can dream and make his dreams come true.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: We do not really feel grateful toward those who make our dreams come true; they ruin our dreams.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Hold fast to dreams for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
quotes.author: Langston Hughes

quotes.quote: I had a dream my life would be different from this hell I am living, so different from what it seemed. Now life has killed the dream I dreamed.
quotes.author: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Many have no happier moments than those that they pass in solitude, abandoned to their own imagination, which sometimes puts scepters in their hands or miters on their heads, shifts the scene of pleasure with endless variety, bids all the forms of beauty sparkle before them, and gluts them with every change of visionary luxury.
quotes.author: Johnson

quotes.quote: All men dream, but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake in the day to find that it was vanity; but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dream with open eyes, to make it possible.
quotes.author: Thomas Edward Lawrence

quotes.quote: It may be that those who do most, dream most.
quotes.author: Stephen Butler Leacock

quotes.quote: Dream tonight of peacock tails, Diamond fields and spouter whales. Ills are many, blessing few, But dreams tonight will shelter you.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: An era can be said to end when its basic illusions are exhausted.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.quote: Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there, wondering, fearing, doubting, dreaming dreams no mortal ever dared to dream before.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: Dreams are the eraser dust I blow off my page. They fade into the emptiness, another dark gray day. Dreams are only memories of the plans I had back then. Dreams are eraser dust and now I use a pen.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: The ninety and nine are with dreams, content but the hope of the world made new, is the hundredth man who is grimly bent on making those dreams come true.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: They who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their grey visions they obtain glimpses of eternity.
quotes.author: Edgar Allan Poe

quotes.quote: You eat, in dreams, the custard of the day.
quotes.author: Alexandar Pope

quotes.quote: Mysterious power, whence hope ethereal springs! Sweet heavenly relic of eternal things! Inspiring oft deep thoughts of things divine: The past, the present, and the future time. Thy reminiscences transport the soul To memory’s Paradise, its future goal.
quotes.author: Parley P. Pratt

quotes.quote: Dream lofty dreams, and as you dream, so shall you become. Your vision is the promise of what you shall at last unveil.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: In Dreams Begin Responsibilities.
quotes.author: Delmore Schwartz

quotes.quote: Our revels now are ended. These our actors, As I foretold you, were all spirits, and Are melted into air, into thin air: And, like the baseless fabric of this vision, The cloud-capp'd towers, the gorgeous palaces, The solemn temples, the great globe itself, Yea, all which it inherit, shall dissolve, And, like this insubstantial pageant faded, Leave not a rack behind. We are such stuff As dreams are made on; and our little life Is rounded with a sleep.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: When the legends die, the dreams end; there is no more greatness.
quotes.author: Tecumseh of the Shawnees

quotes.quote: How many of our daydreams would darken into nightmares, were there a danger of their coming true!
quotes.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.quote: Toil, feel, think, hope; you will be sure to dream enough before you die, without arranging for it.
quotes.author: John Sterling

quotes.quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you've imagined.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: We should show life neither as it is or as it ought to be, but only as we see it in our dreams.
quotes.author: Count Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Dreams are renewable. No matter what our age or condition, there are still untapped possibilities within us and new beauty waiting to be born.
quotes.author: Dr. Dale E. Turner

quotes.quote: My eyes are an ocean in which my dreams are reflected.
quotes.author: Anna M. Uhlich

quotes.quote: We grow great by dreams. All big men are dreamers. They see things in the soft haze of a spring day or in the red fire of a long winter's evening. Some of us let these great dreams die, but others nourish and protect them; nurse them through bad days till they bring them to the sunshine and light which comes always to those who sincerely hope that their dreams will come true.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: But I, being poor, have only my dreams; I have spread my dreams under your feet, Tread softly because you tread on n dreams.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: However vague they are, dreams have a way of concealing themselves and leave us no peace until they are translated into reality, like seeds germinating underground, sure to sprout in their search for the sunlight.
quotes.author: Lin Yutang

quotes.quote: The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want.
quotes.author: Ben Stein

quotes.quote: Our policy is simple: We are not going to betray our friends, reward the enemies of freedom, or permit fear and retreat to become American policies, especially in this hemisphere. None of the wars in my lifetime came about because we were too strong.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: A good objective of leadership is to help those who are doing poorly to do well and to help those who are doing well to do even better.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: You will never be a leader unless you first learn to follow and be led.
quotes.author: Tiorio

quotes.quote: The boss drives people; the leader coaches them. The boss depends on authority; the leader on good will. The boss inspires fear; the leader inspires enthusiasm. The boss says "I"; The leader says "WE". The boss fixes the blame for the breakdown; the leader fixes the breakdown. The boss says, "GO"; the leader says "LET'S GO!"
quotes.author: H. Gordon Selfridge

quotes.quote: Leaders aren't born, they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that's the price we'll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: I am personally convinced that one person can be a change catalyst, a "transformer" in any situation, any organization. Such an individual is yeast that can leaven an entire loaf. It requires vision, initiative, patience, respect, persistence, courage, and faith to be a transforming leader.
quotes.author: Stephen R. Covey

quotes.quote: A boss creates fear, a leader confidence. A boss fixes blame, a leader corrects mistakes. A boss knows all, a leader asks questions. A boss makes work drudgery, a leader makes it interesting. A boss is interested in himself or herself, a leader is interested in the group.
quotes.author: Russell H. Ewing

quotes.quote: One of the true tests of leadership is the ability to recognize a problem before it becomes an emergency.
quotes.author: Arnold Glasow

quotes.quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader works in the open, and the boss in covert. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: A leader takes people where they want to go. A great leader takes people where they don't necessarily want to go, but ought to be.
quotes.author: Rosalynn Carter

quotes.quote: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Muriel Strode

quotes.quote: The challenge of leadership is to be strong, but not rude; be kind, but not weak; be bold, but not bully; be thoughtful, but not lazy; be humble, but not timid; be proud, but not arrogant; have humor, but without folly.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: The best executive is the one who has sense enough to pick good men to do what he wants done, and self-restraint enough to keep from meddling with them while they do it.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Leadership is getting someone to do what they don't want to do, to achieve what they want to achieve.
quotes.author: Toma Landry

quotes.quote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
quotes.author: Sam Walton

quotes.quote: A true leader has the confidence to stand alone, the courage to make tough decisions, and the compassion to listen to the needs of others. He does not set out to be a leader, but becomes one by the equality of his actions and the integrity of his intent.
quotes.author: Douglas McCarther

quotes.quote: If I advance, follow me! If I retreat, kill me! If I die, avenge me!
quotes.author: Francois De La Rochefoucauld

quotes.quote: I have three precious things which I hold fast and prize. The first is gentleness; the second is frugality; the third is humility, which keeps me from putting myself before others. Be gentle and you can be bold; be frugal and you can be liberal; avoid putting yourself before others and you can become a leader among men.
quotes.author: Lao-Tzu

quotes.quote: It is very comforting to believe that leaders who do terrible things are, in fact, mad. That way, all we have to do is make sure we don't put psychotics in high places and we've got the problem solved.
quotes.author: Thomas Wolfe

quotes.quote: An army of deer would be more formidable commanded by a lion, than an army of lions commanded by a stag.
quotes.author: Viking Proverb

quotes.quote: It's not always easy to do the right thing. But, doing the right thing makes you strong, it builds character, it forces you to make decisions based upon your beliefs and not what other people think. In life, and in business, you have to stand for what you believe in and sometimes you have to stand alone. But, what makes you a leader is having the courage of your convictions.
quotes.author: Queen Latifah

quotes.quote: Entrepreneurs are the forgotten heroes of America.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Eagles don't flock - you have to find them one at a time.
quotes.author: H. Ross Perot

quotes.quote: My responsibility, our responsibility as lucky Americans, is to try to give back to this country as much as it has given us, as we continue our American journey together.
quotes.author: Colin Powell

quotes.quote: Not the cry, but the flight of the wild duck, leads the flock to fly and follow.
quotes.author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.quote: The marksman hitteth the target partly by pulling, partly by letting go. The boatsman reached the landing partly by pulling, partly by letting go.
quotes.author: Egyptian Proverb

quotes.quote: The man whose authority is recent is always stern.
quotes.author: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: The leadership instinct you are born with is the backbone. You develop the funny bone and the wishbone that go with it.
quotes.author: Elaine Agather

quotes.quote: Leadership should be born out of the understanding of the needs of those who would be affected by it.
quotes.author: Marian Anderson

quotes.quote: Asked what his secret was for lasting so long and being so successful as the president of YaleUniversity, Dr. James R. Angell explained: "Grow antennae, not horns."
quotes.author: Dr. James Rowland Angell

quotes.quote: A most important key to successful leadership is your ability to direct and challenge the very best that is in those whom you lead.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Success for leadership is . . . knowing the great art of directing others without their noticing it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Remember that to change your mind and follow him who sets you right is to be none the less free than you were before.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius Antoninus

quotes.quote: It's great to work with somebody who wants to do things differently.
quotes.author: Keith Bellow

quotes.quote: . . . power is the basic energy needed to initiate and sustain action or, to put it another way, the capacity to translate intention into reality and sustain it. Leadership is the wise use of this power: Transformative leadership.
quotes.author: Warren G. Bennis

quotes.quote: The most dangerous leadership myth is that leaders are born-that there is a genetic factor to leadership. This myth asserts that people simply either have certain charismatic qualities or not. That's nonsense; in fact, the opposite is true. Leaders are made rather than born.
quotes.author: Warren G. Bennis

quotes.quote: In handling men, there are three feelings that a man must not possess - fear, dislike and contempt. If he is afraid of men he cannot handle them. Neither can he influence them in his favor if he dislikes or scorns them. He must neither cringe nor sneer. He must have both self-respect and respect for others.
quotes.author: Herbert N. Casson

quotes.quote: There are three essentials to leadership: humility, clarity and courage.
quotes.author: Chan Master Fuchan Yuan

quotes.quote: I am certainly not one of those who need to be prodded. In fact, if anything, I am the prod.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer Churchill

quotes.quote: There is no worse mistake in public leadership than to hold out false hope soon to be swept away.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Leonard Spencer Churchill

quotes.quote: Leadership is not magnetic personality, that can just as well be a glib tongue. It is not "making friends and influencing people" -- that is flattery. Leadership is lifting a person's vision to high sights, the raising of a person's performance to a higher standard, the building of a personality beyond its normal limitations.
quotes.author: Peter F. Drucker

quotes.quote: You do not lead by hitting people over the head, that's assault, not leadership.
quotes.author: General David Dwight Eisenhower

quotes.quote: Big jobs usually go to the men who prove their ability to outgrow small ones.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Trust men and they will be true to you; treat them greatly, and they will show themselves great.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The common characteristics of people make a community possible, but it is their uncommon qualities that make it better.
quotes.author: John H. Fischer

quotes.quote: Leadership cannot really be taught. It can only be learned.
quotes.author: Harold S. Green

quotes.quote: The human mind is as driven to understand as the body is driven to survive.
quotes.author: Hugh Gilmore

quotes.quote: A salesman, like the storage battery in your car, is constantly discharging energy. Unless he is recharged at frequent intervals he soon runs dry. This is one of the greatest responsibilities of sales leadership.
quotes.author: R. H. Grant

quotes.quote: What is a committee? A group of the unwilling, picked from the unfit, to do the unnecessary.
quotes.author: Richard Harkness

quotes.quote: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have a vision. It's got to be a vision you articulate clearly and forcefully on every occasion. You can't blow an uncertain trumpet.
quotes.author: Reverend Theodore M. Hesburgh

quotes.quote: The leader has to be practical and a realist, yet must talk the language of the visionary and the idealist.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: Respect a man, he will do the more.
quotes.author: James Howell

quotes.quote: Leadership has a harder job to do than just choose sides. It must bring sides together.
quotes.author: Jesse Jackson

quotes.quote: The only real training for leadership is leadership.
quotes.author: Anthony Jay

quotes.quote: No two men can be half an hour together, but one shall acquire an evident superiority over the other.
quotes.author: Dr. Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: You can send a message around the world in one-fifth of a second, yet it may take years for it to get from the outside of a man's head to the inside.
quotes.author: Charles Franklin Kettering

quotes.quote: Lift, Lead and Love.
quotes.author: Spencer W. Kimball

quotes.quote: A leader is bestWhen people barely know he exists. Not so good When people obey and acclaim him. Worse when they despise him. But of a good leader Who talks little When his work is done, His aim fulfilled, They will say "We did it ourselves."
quotes.author: Lao Tse

quotes.quote: Rule a kingdom as though you were cooking a small fish, don't overdo it.
quotes.author: Lao Tse

quotes.quote: There are no dumb questions, only dumb answers.
quotes.author: Marshall Loeb

quotes.quote: Leadership is influence.
quotes.author: John C. Maxwell

quotes.quote: Leadership is an action, not a position.
quotes.author: Donald H. McGannon

quotes.quote: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
quotes.author: Michael O'Brien

quotes.quote: The spirited horse, which will try to win the race of its own accord, will run ever faster if encouraged.
quotes.author: Publius Ovidius Naso Ovid

quotes.quote: One measure of leadership is the caliber of people who choose to follow you.
quotes.author: Dennis A. Peer

quotes.quote: No man is fit to command another that cannot command himself.
quotes.author: William Penn

quotes.quote: The same ambition can destroy or save, And makes a patriot as it makes a knave.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.quote: Leadership is the ability of a single individual through his or her actions to motivate others to higher levels of achievement.
quotes.author: F. G. Buck Rodgers

quotes.quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: To lead in the 21st century-to take soldiers, sailors, and airmen into battle, you will be required to have both character and competence.
quotes.author: General H. Norman Schwarzkopf

quotes.quote: He who reads is never alone.
quotes.author: Helder Simone

quotes.quote: Learn to obey before you command.
quotes.author: Solon

quotes.quote: I am more afraid of an army of 100 sheep led by a lion than an army of 100 lions led by a sheep.
quotes.author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand--Perigord

quotes.quote: Certainly a leader needs a clear vision of the organization and where it is going, but a vision is of little value unless it is shared in a way so as to generate enthusiasm and commitment. Leadership and communication are inseparable.
quotes.author: Claude I. Taylor

quotes.quote: Consensus is the negation of leadership.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.quote: It is much safer to obey, than to govern.
quotes.author: Thomas Kempis

quotes.quote: A President either is constantly on top of events or, if he hesitates, events will soon be on top of him. I never felt that I could let up for a single moment.
quotes.author: Harry S. Truman

quotes.quote: Men make history, and not the other way around. In periods where there is no leadership, society stands still. Progress occurs when courageous, skillful leaders seize the opportunity to change things for the better.
quotes.author: Harry S. Truman

quotes.quote: Every man who takes office . . . either grows or swells, and when I give a man an office, I watch him carefully to see whether he is swelling or growing.
quotes.author: Thomas Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: Have patience with all things, but chiefly have patience with yourself. Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections but instantly set about remedying them every day begin the task anew.
quotes.author: Saint Francis de Sales

quotes.quote: I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies; for the hardest victory is over self.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Winning is everything, to win is all there is. Only those poor souls buried beneath the battlefield understand this.
quotes.author: SEAL Team Saying

quotes.quote: All right Mister, let me tell you what winning means - you're willing to go longer, work harder, give more than anyone else.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Winning is not everything, but the effort to win is.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: The reason most people never reach their goals is that they don't define them, learn about them, or even seriously consider them as believable or achievable. Winners can tell you where they are going, what they plan to do along the way, and who will be sharing the adventure with them.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.quote: History has demonstrated that the most notable winners usually encountered heartbreaking obstacles before they triumphed. They won because they refused to become discouraged by their defeats.
quotes.author: Bertie C. Forbes

quotes.quote: The man who can drive himself further once the effort gets painful is the man who will win.
quotes.author: Roger Bannister

quotes.quote: You can't be a winner and be afraid to lose.
quotes.author: Charles Lynch

quotes.quote: Those that know how to win are much more numerous than those who know how to make proper use of their victories.
quotes.author: Polybius

quotes.quote: Guts are a combination of confidence, courage, conviction, strength of character, stick-to-itiveness, pugnaciousness, backbone, and intestinal fortitude. They are mandatory for anyone who wants to get to and stay at the top.
quotes.author: D.A. Benton

quotes.quote: Only a man who knows what it is like to be defeated can reach down to the bottom of his soul and come up with extra ounce of power it takes to win when the match is even.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
quotes.author: Andrew Carnegie

quotes.quote: I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live by the light that I have. I must stand with anybody that stands right, and stand with him while he is right, and part with him when he goes wrong.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Never let defeat have the last word.
quotes.author: Tibetan Proverb

quotes.quote: There is no victory at bargain basement prices.
quotes.author: Dwight David Eisenhower

quotes.quote: There are many victories worse than a defeat.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Your ability to be a winner 100 percent of the time is based upon giving up the notion that losing at anything is equivalent to being a loser.
quotes.author: Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.quote: The man who wins may have been counted out several times, but he didn't hear the referee.
quotes.author: H. E. Jansen

quotes.quote: Nobody remembers who came in second.
quotes.author: Charles Schulz

quotes.quote: That's what learning is, after all; not whether we lose the game, but how we lose and how we've changed because of it and what we take away from it that we never had before, to apply to other games. Losing, in a curious way, is winning.
quotes.author: Richard David Bach

quotes.quote: If any thing goes bad, I did it. If anything goes semi-good, we did it. If anything goes really good, then you did it. That's all it takes to get people to win football games for you.
quotes.author: Paul "Bear" Bryant

quotes.quote: If winning isn't important, why do we spend all that money on scoreboards?
quotes.author: Chuck Coonradt

quotes.quote: If winning isn't important, why keep score?
quotes.author: Star Trek: The Next Generation

quotes.quote: Everybody is born with an equal chance to become just as unequal as he or she possibly can.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The most momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or to evil.
quotes.author: Pythagoras

quotes.quote: There are only two places in this league: first place and no place.
quotes.author: Tom Seaver

quotes.quote: We are not interested in the possibilities of defeat.
quotes.author: Queen Victoria

quotes.quote: You carry on no matter what are the obstacles. You simply refuse to give up - and, when the going gets tough, you get tougher. And, you win.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: You don't win once in a while; you don't do things right once in a while; you do them right all the time.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: If you'll not settle for anything less than your best, you'll be amazed at what you can accomplish in your lives.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: It's not whether you get knocked down: it's whether you get up.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Winning is a habit. Unfortunately, so is losing.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Regardless of what you do put in, every game boils down to doing the things you do best and doing them over and over again.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Some of us will do our jobs well and some will not, but we will all be judged by only one thing - the result.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: It's easy to have faith in yourself and have discipline when you're a winner, when you're No. 1. What you've got to have is faith and discipline when you're not yet a winner.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Once you agree upon the price you and your family must pay for success it enables you to ignore the minor hurts, the opponent's pressure, the temporary failures.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Success demands singleness of purpose.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Winners dwell on and hold the self-image of that person they would most like to become. They get a vivid, clear, emotional, sensory picture of themselves as if they had already achieved their new role in life.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Ever notice that people never say "It's only a game" when they're winning?
quotes.author: Ivern Ball

quotes.quote: The prizes go to those who meet emergencies successfully. And the way to meet emergencies is to do each daily task the best we can; to act as though the eye of opportunity were always upon us. In the hundred-yard race the winner doesn't cross the tape line a dozen strides ahead of the field. He wins by inches. So we find it in ordinary business life. The big things that come our way are seldom the result of long thought or careful planning, but rather they are the fruit of seed planted in the daily routine of our work.
quotes.author: William Feather

quotes.quote: There is no relief at it being over. There is the joy of winning it.
quotes.author: Steffi Graf

quotes.quote: There's nothing to winning, really. That is, if you happen to be blessed with a keen eye, an agile mind, and no scruples whatsoever.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.quote: The art of winning in business is in working hard, not taking things too seriously.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: I am not one of those who think that coming in second or third is winning.
quotes.author: Robert Kennedy

quotes.quote: And the trouble with me is that my ego just can't accept a loss. I suppose that if I were more perfectly adjusted, I would toss off defeat, but my name is on this ball club. Thirty-six men publicly reflect me and reflect on me, and it's a matter of my pride.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Winning isn't everything, but the will to win is everything.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: Winners are naturally bullish.
quotes.author: Merrill Lynch

quotes.quote: If you cannot win, make the one ahead of you break the record.
quotes.author: Jan McKeithen

quotes.quote: Who overcomes by force, hath overcome but half his foe.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: When you win, nothing hurts.
quotes.author: Joe Namath

quotes.quote: My serve was there, everything was just clicking. Those are the days you dream about, especially in a final.
quotes.author: Pete Sampras

quotes.quote: There are 100 men seeking security to one able man who is willing to risk his fortune.
quotes.author: J. Paul Getty

quotes.quote: To win without risk is to triumph without glory.
quotes.author: Pierre Corneille
