quotes.quote: There is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: You leave old habits behind by starting out with the thought, 'I release the need for this in my life'.
quotes.author: Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence then, is not an act, but a habit.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: A nail is driven out by another nail. Habit is overcome by habit.
quotes.author: Desiderius Erasmus

quotes.quote: First we form habits, then they form us. Conquer your bad habits or they will conquer you.
quotes.author: Rob Gilbert

quotes.quote: Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.
quotes.author: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

quotes.quote: Power is the faculty or capacity to act, the strength and potency to accomplish something. It is the vital energy to make choices and decisions. It also includes the capacity to overcome deeply embedded habits and to cultivate higher, more effective ones.
quotes.author: Stephen R. Covey

quotes.quote: Your net worth to the world is usually determined by what remains after your bad habits are subtracted from your good ones.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Habits - the only reason they persist is that they are offering some satisfaction. You allow them to persist by not seeking any other, better form of satisfying the same needs. Every habit, good or bad, is acquired and learned in the same way - by finding that it is a means of satisfaction.
quotes.author: Juliene Berk

quotes.quote: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
quotes.author: Vince Lombardi

quotes.quote: I never could have done what I have done without the habits of punctuality, order, and diligence, without the determination to concentrate myself on one subject at a time.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: It is hard to let old beliefs go. They are familiar. We are comfortable with them and have spent years building systems and developing habits that depend on them. Like a man who has worn eyeglasses so long that he forgets he has them on, we forget that the world looks to us the way it does because we have become used to seeing it that way through a particular set of lenses. Today, however, we need new lenses. And we need to throw the old ones away.
quotes.author: Kenich Ohmae

quotes.quote: Good habits result from resisting temptation.
quotes.author: Indian Proverb

quotes.quote: As a twig is bent the tree inclines.
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.quote: Thoughts lead on to purposes; purposes go forth in action; actions form habits; habits decide character; and character fixes our destiny.
quotes.author: Tryon Edwards

quotes.quote: Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.
quotes.author: Henry Adams

quotes.quote: A man’s fortune has its form given to it by his habits.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Bad habits are like a comfortable bed, easy to get into, but hard to get out of.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: What a curious phenomenon it is that you can get men to die for the liberty of the world who will not make the little sacrifice that is needed to free themselves from their own individual bondage.
quotes.author: Bruce Barton

quotes.quote: 1. Be Proactive. 2. Begin with the end in mind. 3. Put first things first. 4. Think win win. 5. Seek first to understand . . . then to be understood. 6. Synergize. 7. Sharpen the saw.
quotes.author: Stephen R. Covey

quotes.quote: It seems, in fact, as though the second half of a man’s life is made up of nothing but the habits he has accumulated during the first half.
quotes.author: Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky

quotes.quote: All habits gather by unseen degrees, As brooks make rivers, rivers run to seas.
quotes.author: John Dryden

quotes.quote: Any act often repeated soon forms a habit; and habit allowed, steadily gains in strength. At first it may be but as the spider's web, easily broken through, but if not resisted it soon binds us with chains of steel.
quotes.author: Tyron Edwards

quotes.quote: The long span of the bridge of your life is supported by countless cables called habits, attitudes, and desires. What you do in life depends upon what you are and what you want. What you get from life depends upon how much you want it, how much you are willing to work and plan and cooperate and use your resources. The long span of the bridge of your life is supported by countless cables that you are spinning now, and that is why today is such an important day. Make the cables strong!
quotes.author: L.G. Elliott

quotes.quote: Heartily know, When half-gods go, The gods arrive.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: We are what we think; as we desire so do we become! By our thoughts, desires, and habits, we either ascend to the full divine dignity of our nature, or we descend to suffer and learn.
quotes.author: J. Todd Ferrier

quotes.quote: Every woman should eat for the long run so she can manage the short stops of crisis.
quotes.author: Jane Fonda

quotes.quote: We're worn into grooves by Time by our habits. In the end, these grooves are going to show whether we've been second rate or champions, each in his way in dispatching the affairs of every day. By choosing our habits, we determine the grooves into which Time will wear us; and these are grooves that enrich our lives and make for ease of mind, peace, happiness achievement.
quotes.author: Frank B. Gilberth

quotes.quote: Those who have attained things worth having in this world have worked while others idled, have persevered when others gave up in despair, have practiced early in life the valuable habits of self-denial, industry, and singleness of purpose. As a result, they enjoy in later life the success so often erroneously attributed to good luck.
quotes.author: Grenville Kleiser

quotes.quote: The unfortunate thing about this world is that good habits are so much easier to give up than bad ones.
quotes.author: William Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: Small habits well pursued betimes May reach the dignity of crimes.
quotes.author: Hannah More

quotes.quote: Habits change into character.
quotes.author: Publius Ovidius Naso Ovid

quotes.quote: A large part of virtue consists in good habits.
quotes.author: Barbara Paley

quotes.quote: Moral habits, induced by public practices, are far quicker in making their way into men’s private lives, than the failings and faults of individuals are in infecting the city at large.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: How use doth breed a habit in a man!
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: In one sense the whole process of development consists of the formation of habits; for knowledge itself, and the powers of thought, as well as the higher elements in the will, all depend upon the establishment of fixed ways of reacting to given stimuli. Consequently, the general laws of habituation underlie the whole of education. But the term habit is more commonly restricted to those established reactions that act with little or no participation of consciousness, or, in other words, mechanically or automatically. Such habits as these begin to form very early, and constitute a kind of supporting framework for the higher elements of character.
quotes.author: Edward O. Sisson

quotes.quote: The secret of the whole matter is that a habit is not the mere tendency to repeat a certain act, nor is it established by the mere repetition of the act. Habit is a fixed tendency to react or respond in a certain way to a given stimulus; and the formation of habit always involves the two elements, the stimulus and the response or reaction. The indolent lad goes to school not in response to any stimulus in the school itself, but to the pressure of his father's will; when that stimulus is absent, the reaction as a matter of course does not occur.
quotes.author: Edward O. Sisson

quotes.quote: Powerful indeed is the empire of habit.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: A habit cannot be tossed out the window; it must be coaxed down the stairs a step at a time.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Nothing so needs reforming as other people’s habits.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: No matter how old you get, if you can keep the desire to be creative, you're keeping the man-child alive.
quotes.author: John Cassavetes

quotes.quote: Action on the move creates its own route, creates to a very great extent the conditions under which it is to be fulfilled and thus baffles all calculation.
quotes.author: Henri Bergson

quotes.quote: Divide each difficulty into as many parts as necessary to resolve it.
quotes.author: Rene Descartes

quotes.quote: Courage is a special kind of knowledge; the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
quotes.author: David Ben

quotes.quote: Those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Formal education will make you a living. Self-education will make you a fortune.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: The highest form of ignorance is to reject something you know nothing about.
quotes.author: Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

quotes.quote: Every mind was made for growth, for knowledge, and its nature is sinned against when it is doomed to ignorance.
quotes.author: William Ellery Channing

quotes.quote: You can swim all day in the Sea of Knowledge and still come out completely dry. Most people do.
quotes.author: Norman Juster

quotes.quote: Knowledge is power and enthusiasm pulls the switch.
quotes.author: Steve Droke

quotes.quote: Not to know is bad, not to wish to know is worse.
quotes.author: Nigerian Proverb

quotes.quote: The old believe everything; the middle aged suspect everything, the young know everything.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
quotes.author: T. S. Elliot

quotes.quote: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: The essence of knowledge is, having it, to apply it; not having it, to confess your ignorance.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Today knowledge has power. It controls access to opportunity and advancement.
quotes.author: Peter F. Drucker

quotes.quote: God grant that not only the love of liberty but a thorough knowledge of the rights of man may pervade all the nations of the earth, so that a philosopher may set his foot anywhere on its surface and say: This is my country!
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Knowledge is of two kinds: We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information about it.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: The hunger and thirst for knowledge, the keen delight in the chase, the good humored willingness to admit that the scent was false, the eager desire to get on with the work, the cheerful resolution to go back and begin again, the broad good sense, the unaffected modesty, the imperturbable temper, the gratitude for any little help that was given - all these will remain in my memory though I cannot paint them for others.
quotes.author: Frederic William Maitland

quotes.quote: It is nothing for one to know something unless another knows you know it.
quotes.author: Persian Proverb

quotes.quote: To know that we know what we know, and that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The trouble with the world is not that people know too little, but that they know so many things that ain't so.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
quotes.author: John Archibald Wheeler

quotes.quote: I realized that far beyond the possibilities of bodily thought there were in myself forces, powers and knowledge far transcending all that the body can ever perceive or imagine in its loftiest flights.
quotes.author: The Golden Dawn

quotes.quote: Man's flight through life is sustained by the power of his knowledge.
quotes.author: U.S. Air Force

quotes.quote: Not to know is bad; not to wish to know is worse.
quotes.author: African Proverb

quotes.quote: You can out distance that which is running after you, but not what is running inside you.
quotes.author: Rwandan Proverb

quotes.quote: 'How do you know so much about everything?' was asked of a very wise and intelligent man; and the answer was 'By never being afraid or ashamed to ask questions as to anything of which I was ignorant.
quotes.author: John Abbott

quotes.quote: The preservation of the means of knowledge among the lowest ranks is of more importance to the public than all the property of all the rich men in the country.
quotes.author: John Adams

quotes.quote: I am what I am and I have the need to be.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: If you want to be somebody, somebody really special, be yourself.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Insecurity exists in the absence of knowledge.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Knowledge become power only when we put it into use.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Knowledge is boundless but the capacity of one man is limited.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Knowledge is not what you can remember, but what you cannot forget.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Learning is like rowing upstream. Advance or lose all.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Men have a tendency to believe what they least understand.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Once you've accumulated sufficient knowledge to get by, you're too old to remember it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Teachers open the door, but you enter by yourself.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The more you know, the less you need to show.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The real key to health and happiness and success is self knowledge.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: There has been an alarming increase in the number of things you know nothing about.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: We are drowning in information and starved for knowledge.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Whoever acquires knowledge but does not practice it, is like one who ploughs a field but does not sow it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: If . . . happiness is the absence of fever then I will never know happiness. For I am posessed by a fever for knowledge, experience and creation.
quotes.author: Anais Nin

quotes.quote: All men by nature desire to know.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Resolve to be thyself: and know that he - Who finds himself loses his misery.
quotes.author: Mathew Arnold

quotes.quote: The conqueror and king in each of us is the . . . Knower of truth. . . . Let that Knower awaken in us and drive the horses of the mind, emotions, and physical body on the pathway which that king has chosen.
quotes.author: George S. Arundale

quotes.quote: Scientific apparatus offers a window to knowledge, but as they grow more elaborate, scientists spend ever more time washing the windows.
quotes.author: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: To wisdom belongs the intellectual apprehension of things eternal; to knowledge, the rational apprehension of things temporal.
quotes.author: Saint Augustine

quotes.quote: A woman, especially, if she have the misfortune of knowing anything, should conceal it as well as she can.
quotes.author: Jane Austin

quotes.quote: For knowledge, too, is itself power.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Knowledge and human power are synonymous, since the ignorance of the cause frustrates the effect.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Knowledge is a rich storehouse for the glory of the Creator and the relief of man’s estate.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: The images of men’s wits and knowledge remain in books. . . . They generate still, and cast their seeds in the minds of others, provoking and causing infinite actions and opinions in succeeding ages.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Knowledge is power, but enthusiasm pulls the switch.
quotes.author: Ivern Ball

quotes.quote: Only as you do know yourself can your brain serve you as a sharp and efficient tool. Know your failings, passions, and prejudices so you can separate them from what you see. Know also when you actually have thought through to the nature of the thing with which you are dealing and when you are not thinking at all.
quotes.author: Bernard Mannes Baruch

quotes.quote: Can anything be beyond the knowledge of a man like you?
quotes.author: Pierre Augustin Caron de Beaumarchais

quotes.quote: First come I; my name is Jowett. There’s no knowledge but I know it. I am Master of this college: What I don’t know isn't knowledge.
quotes.author: Henry Charles Beeching

quotes.quote: Of all that writ, he was the wisest bard, who spoke this mighty truth? He that knew all that ever learning writ, Knew only this, that he knew nothing yet.
quotes.author: Aphra Behn

quotes.quote: It's not only the most difficult thing to know one's self, but the most inconvenient.
quotes.author: Josh Billings

quotes.quote: More appealing than knowledge itself is the feeling of knowledge.
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quotes.quote: Many a man who has known himself at ten forgets himself utterly between ten and thirty.
quotes.author: Catherine Drinker Bowen

quotes.quote: The one self-knowledge worth having is to know one's own mind.
quotes.author: Francis Herbert Bradley

quotes.quote: One secures the gold of the spirit when he finds himself.
quotes.author: Claude M. Bristol

quotes.quote: One of the most common reasons so few people are consistently able to achieve meaningful results is that they are unwilling to experience the discomfort associated with relentlessly pursuing a correct perception of reality.
quotes.author: Stuart Brodie

quotes.quote: To know oneself, one should assert oneself. Psychology is action, not thinking about oneself. We continue to shape our personality all our life.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The self-explorer, whether he wants to or not, becomes the explorer of everything else. He learns to see himself, but suddenly, provided he was honest, all the rest appears, and it is as rich as he was, and, as a final crowning, richer.
quotes.author: Elias Canetti

quotes.quote: Never mistake knowledge for wisdom. One helps you make a living; the other helps you make a life.
quotes.author: Sandra Carey

quotes.quote: That there should one man die ignorant who had capacity for knowledge, this I call a tragedy.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: There are lots of things that you can brush under the carpet about yourself until you're faced with somebody whose needs won't be put off.
quotes.author: Angela Carter

quotes.quote: The more a man knows, the more he forgives.
quotes.author: Catherine the Great

quotes.quote: To learn to get along without, to realize that what the world is going to demand of us may be a good deal more important than what we are entitled to demand of it, this is a hard lesson.
quotes.author: Bruce Catton

quotes.quote: In every case, the remedy is to take action. Get clear about exactly what it is that you need to learn and exactly what you need to do to learn it. BEING CLEAR KILLS FEAR. Make it thy business to know thyself, which is the most difficult lesson in the world.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: The most excellent and divine counsel, the best and most profitable advertisement of all others, but the least practiced, is to study and learn how to know ourselves. This is the foundation of wisdom and the highway to whatever is good. . . . God, Nature, the wise, the world, preach man, exhort him both by word and deed to the study of himself.
quotes.author: Pierre Charron

quotes.quote: A man does not know what he is saying until he knows what he is not saying.
quotes.author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quotes.quote: One may understand the cosmos, but never the ego; the self is more distant than any star.
quotes.author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton

quotes.quote: You already know enough to go to hell.
quotes.author: David A. Christensen

quotes.quote: I prefer tongue-tied knowledge to ignorant loquacity.
quotes.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.quote: He that knows himself, knows others; and he that is ignorant of himself, could not write a very profound lecture on other men's heads.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it this is knowledge.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Knowledge is proud that he has learned so much; Wisdom is humble that he knows no more.
quotes.author: William Cowper

quotes.quote: In your thirst for knowledge, be sure not to drown in all the information.
quotes.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quotes.quote: Never stop learning; knowledge doubles every fourteen months.
quotes.author: Anthony J. D'Angelo

quotes.quote: Consider your origins: you were not made that you might live as brutes, but so as to follow virtue and knowledge.
quotes.author: Dante Alighieri

quotes.quote: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
quotes.author: Charles Robert Darwin

quotes.quote: The dawn of knowledge is usually the false dawn.
quotes.author: Bernard De Voto

quotes.quote: Best efforts will not substitute for knowledge.
quotes.author: Dr. W. Edward Deming

quotes.quote: Nothing is easier than self-deceit. For what each man wishes, that he also believes to be true.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: Timidity is mistrust of self, and proceeds not from modesty but from conceit. A man is timid because he is afraid of not appearing to his best advantage.
quotes.author: Diane

quotes.quote: Nurture your mind with great thoughts, for you will never go any higher than you think.
quotes.author: Benjamin DIsraeli

quotes.quote: Knowledge is the eye of desire and can become the pilot of the soul.
quotes.author: Will Durant

quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge, for knowledge is limited while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: It is, I fear, but a vain show of fulfilling the heathen precept, "Know thyself," and too often leads to a self-estimate which will subsist in the absence of that fruit by which alone the quality of the tree is made evident.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? - Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
quotes.author: T.S.Eliot

quotes.quote: Knowledge is an antidote to fear.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I was born not knowing and have only had a little time to change that here and there.
quotes.author: Richard Phillips Feynman

quotes.quote: Know what you want. . . . Become your real self.
quotes.author: David Harold Fink

quotes.quote: You have to know what's important and what's unimportant, for you.
quotes.author: David Harold Fink

quotes.quote: He knows the universe and does not know himself.
quotes.author: Jean De La Fontaine

quotes.quote: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning today is young. The greatest thing in life is to keep your mind young.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: To know is nothing at all; to imagine is everything.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: To be proud of knowledge is to be blind with light.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Knowledge is the intellectual manipulation of carefully verified observations.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: We will discover the nature of our particular genius when we stop trying to conform to our own or to other people's models, learn to be ourselves, and allow our natural channel to open.
quotes.author: Shakti Gawain

quotes.quote: Thoroughly to know oneself, is above all art, for it is the highest art.
quotes.author: Theologia Germanica

quotes.quote: And what is word knowledge but a shadow of wordless knowledge?
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: He who repeats what he does not understand is no better than an ass that is loaded with books.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Knowledge and understanding are life’s faithful companions who will never prove untrue to you. For knowledge is your crown, and understanding your staff; and when they are with you, you can possess no greater treasures.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Knowledge begets knowledge. The more I see, the more impressed I am not with what we know but with how tremendous the areas are as yet unexplored.
quotes.author: John H. Glenn, Jr.

quotes.quote: Knowledge of our duties is the most essential part of the philosophy of life. If you escape duty you avoid action. The world demands results.
quotes.author: George W. Goethals

quotes.quote: Belief is not the beginning of knowledge, it is the end.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: It is not enough to have knowledge, one must also apply it. It is not enough to have wishes, one must also accomplish.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: No one has ever learned fully to know themselves.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Self-knowledge comes from knowing other men.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: What is not fully understood is not possessed.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: People seldom improve when they have no other model but themselves to copy after.
quotes.author: Oliver Goldsmith

quotes.quote: Without self knowledge, without understanding the working and functions of his machine, man cannot be free, he cannot govern himself and he will always remain a slave.
quotes.author: Goerge Gurdjieff

quotes.quote: A man is never astonished that he doesn't know what another does, but he is surprised at the gross ignorance of the other in not knowing what he does.
quotes.author: Halibuton

quotes.quote: Head knowledge is good, but heart knowledge is indispensable. The training of the hands and feet must be added to make a rounded education. We must all learn these days to become spiritual pioneers if we would save the world from chaos.
quotes.author: E. V. Hammond

quotes.quote: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
quotes.author: Augustus William Hare

quotes.quote: When a person is groping in life, we say he has not found himself. This statement is not accurate. Self is created, not found.
quotes.author: Grant Von Harrison

quotes.quote: If we really love ourselves, everything in our life works.
quotes.author: Louise L. Hay

quotes.quote: This is the bitterest pain among men, to have much knowledge but no power.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: Our credulity is greatest concerning the things we know least about. And since we know least about ourselves, we are ready to believe all that is said about us. Hence the mysterious power of both flattery and calumny.
quotes.author: Eric Hoffer

quotes.quote: It is the province of knowledge to speak and it is the privilege of wisdom to listen.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: The best part of our knowledge is that which teaches us where knowledge leaves off and ignorance begins.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quotes.quote: Getting in touch with your true self must be your first priority.
quotes.author: Tom Hopkins

quotes.quote: The idea that is not dangerous is not worthy of being called an idea at all.
quotes.author: Elbert Green Hubbard

quotes.quote: The great end of life is not knowledge but action.
quotes.author: T.H. Huxley

quotes.quote: If a little knowledge is dangerous, where is the man who has so much as to be out of danger?
quotes.author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quotes.quote: It is not the answer that enlightens, but the question.
quotes.author: Eugene Ionesco

quotes.quote: Perfect knowledge comes only when you see the world in yourself, just as he who awakes from the dream then knows he saw his dream-world with its suns and stars in himself.
quotes.author: V.S. Iyser

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it, misdiagnosing it, and then misapplying the wrong remedies.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: He who seeks equality amongst unequals seeks the absurd.
quotes.author: Spinoza

quotes.quote: In politics, you can recover from anything except looking like a fool.
quotes.author: Alma Guillermoprieto

quotes.quote: There is a thin line between politics and theatricals.
quotes.author: Julian Bond

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of postponing decisions until they are no longer relevant.
quotes.author: Henri Queuille

quotes.quote: Politics: “Poli” a Latin word meaning “many”; and "tics" meaning “bloodsucking creatures”.
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: When you give food to the poor, they call you a saint. When you ask why the poor have no food, they call you a communist.
quotes.author: Archbishop Helder Camara

quotes.quote: A politician needs the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month, and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn't happen.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Everything is changing. People are taking their comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Political language is designed to make lies sound truthful and murder respectable, and to give an appearance of solidity to pure wind.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.
quotes.author: Henry Kissinger

quotes.quote: The most successful politician is he who says what the people are thinking most often in the loudest voice.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Bad politicians are sent to Washington by good people who don't vote.
quotes.author: William E. Simon

quotes.quote: The magician and the politician have much in common: they both have to draw our attention away from what they are really doing.
quotes.author: Ben Okri

quotes.quote: My choice early in life was either to be a piano-player in a whorehouse or a politician. And to tell the truth, there's hardly any difference.
quotes.author: Harry S Truman

quotes.quote: The ability to change one's views without losing one's seat is the mark of a great politician.
quotes.author: Morris K. Udall

quotes.quote: It is hard to imagine a more stupid or more dangerous way of making decisions than by putting those decisions in the hands of people who pay no price for being wrong.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.quote: Politicians never accuse you of 'greed' for wanting other people's money - only for wanting to keep your own money.
quotes.author: Joseph Sobran

quotes.quote: For a politician to complain about the press is like a ship's captain complaining about the sea.
quotes.author: Enoch Powell

quotes.quote: Talkers are usually more articulate than doers, since talk is their specialty.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.quote: There exists no politician in India daring enough to attempt to explain to the masses that cows can be eaten.
quotes.author: Indira Gandhi

quotes.quote: He knows nothing; he thinks he knows everything - that clearly points to a political career.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: If you tell a lie big enough and keep repeating it, people will eventually come to believe it. The lie can be maintained only for such time as the State can shield the people from the political, economic and/or military consequences of the lie. It thus becomes vitally important for the State to use all of its powers to repress dissent, for the truth is the mortal enemy of the lie, and thus by extension, the truth is the greatest enemy of the State.
quotes.author: Joseph Goebbels

quotes.quote: The first panacea for a mismanaged nation is inflation of the currency; the second is war. Both bring a temporary prosperity; both bring a permanent ruin. But both are - the refuge of political and economic opportunist.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemmingway

quotes.quote: The best political weapon is the weapon of terror. Cruelty commands respect. Men may hate us. But, we don't ask for their love; only for their fear.
quotes.author: Heinrich Himmler

quotes.quote: Political correctness does not legislate tolerance; it only organizes hatred.
quotes.author: Jacques Barzun

quotes.quote: History suggests that capitalism is a necessary condition for political freedom.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.
quotes.author: Mao Tse-tung

quotes.quote: There is no maxim, in my opinion, which is more liable to be misapplied, and which, therefore, more needs elucidation, than the current one, that the interest of the majority is the political standard of right and wrong.
quotes.author: James Madison

quotes.quote: Never believe anything in politics until it has been officially denied.
quotes.author: Otto von Bismarck

quotes.quote: Every decent man is ashamed of the government he lives under.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: Man will never be free until the last king is strangled with the entrails of the last priest.
quotes.author: Denis Diderot

quotes.quote: People never lie so much as after a hunt, during a war or before an election.
quotes.author: Otto von Bismarck

quotes.quote: A statesman is a successful politician who is dead.
quotes.author: Thomas Brackett Reed

quotes.quote: You campaign in poetry. You govern in prose.
quotes.author: Mario Cuomo

quotes.quote: The poor object to being governed badly, while the rich object to being governed at all.
quotes.author: GK Chesterton

quotes.quote: Bureaucracy is a giant mechanism operated by pygmies.
quotes.author: Balzac

quotes.quote: Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.
quotes.author: Robert Orben

quotes.quote: My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The last thing I ever wanted was to be alive when the three most powerful people on the whole planet would be named Bush, Dick and Colon.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: The smallest minority on earth is the individual. Those who deny individual rights cannot claim to be defenders of minorities.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: I'm completely in favor of the separation of Church and State... These two institutions screw us up enough on their own, so both of them together is certain death.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: In politics, stupidity is not a handicap.
quotes.author: Napoléon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: The first duty of a man is to think for himself.
quotes.author: José Martí

quotes.quote: The only difference between Hitler and Bush is that Hitler was elected.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Too bad that all the people who know how to run the country are busy driving taxicabs and cutting hair.
quotes.author: George Burns

quotes.quote: The rights of every man are diminished when the rights of one man are threatened.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The oppressed are allowed once every few years to decide which particular representatives of the oppressing class are to represent and repress them.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: A nation of sheep will beget a government of wolves.
quotes.author: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: Absolute power does not corrupt absolutely, absolute power attracts the corruptible.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.
quotes.author: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.quote: You show me a capitalist, and I'll show you a bloodsucker.
quotes.author: Malcolm X

quotes.quote: If you want to rebel, rebel from inside the system. That’s much more powerful than rebelling outside the system.
quotes.author: Marie Lu

quotes.quote: If our Founding Fathers wanted us to care about the rest of the world, they wouldn't have declared their independence from it.
quotes.author: Stephen Colbert

quotes.quote: If an injury has to be done to a man it should be so severe that his vengeance need not be feared.
quotes.author: Niccolò Machiavelli

quotes.quote: As government expands liberty contracts.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Bad men need nothing more to compass their ends, than that good men should look on and do nothing.
quotes.author: John Stuart Mill

quotes.quote: Politics, it seems to me, for years, or all too long, has been concerned with right or left instead of right or wrong.
quotes.author: Richard Armour

quotes.quote: Politicians and diapers should be changed frequently and all for the same reason.
quotes.author: José Maria de Eça de Queiroz

quotes.quote: We live in a world in which politics has replaced philosophy.
quotes.author: Martin L. Gross

quotes.quote: There are many men of principle in both parties in America, but there is no party of principle.
quotes.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quotes.quote: We'd all like to vote for the best man, but he's never a candidate.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: In order to become the master, the politician poses as the servant.
quotes.author: Charles de Gaulle

quotes.quote: Those who are too smart to engage in politics are punished by being governed by those who are dumber.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Politicians are the same all over. They promise to build a bridge even where there is no river.
quotes.author: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.quote: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President; I'm beginning to believe it.
quotes.author: Clarence Darrow

quotes.quote: Truth is not determined by majority vote.
quotes.author: Doug Gwyn

quotes.quote: We have, I fear, confused power with greatness.
quotes.author: Stewart Udall

quotes.quote: A conservative is a man who believes that nothing should be done for the first time.
quotes.author: Alfred E. Wiggam

quotes.quote: Don't vote, it only encourages them.
quotes.author: Billy Connolly

quotes.quote: Any American who is prepared to run for president should automatically, by definition, be disqualified from ever doing so.
quotes.author: Gore Vidal

quotes.quote: Politics is the gentle art of getting votes from the poor and campaign funds from the rich, by promising to protect each from the other.
quotes.author: Oscar Ameringer

quotes.quote: Members of Congress should be compelled to wear uniforms like NASCAR drivers, so we could identify their corporate sponsors.
quotes.author: Caroline Baum

quotes.quote: Some men change their party for the sake of their principles; others their principles for the sake of their party.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: The most intense hatreds are not between political parties but within them.
quotes.author: Phillip Adams

quotes.quote: When we are sick, we want an uncommon doctor; when we have a construction job to do, we want an uncommon engineer, and when we are at war, we want an uncommon general. It is only when we get into politics that we are satisfied with the common man.
quotes.author: Herbert Hoover

quotes.quote: In war, you can only be killed once, but in politics, many times.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day. Teach a man to fish and he will eat for a lifetime. Teach a man to create an artificial shortage of fish and he will eat steak.
quotes.author: Jay Leno

quotes.quote: You can fool all the people all the time if the advertising is right and the budget is big enough.
quotes.author: Joseph E. Levine

quotes.quote: When you're out of quality you're out of business.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Hire character. Train skill.
quotes.author: Peter Schutz

quotes.quote: Music is spiritual. The music business is not.
quotes.author: Van Morrison

quotes.quote: Think P.I.G. - that’s my motto. P stands for Persistence, I stands for Integrity, and G stands for Guts. These are the ingredients for a successful business and a successful life.
quotes.author: Linda Chandler

quotes.quote: Perpetual devotion to what a man calls his business, is only to be sustained by perpetual neglect of many other things.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: In the end, all business operations can be reduced to three words: people, product and profits. Unless you've got a good team, you can't do much with the other two.
quotes.author: Lee Iacocca

quotes.quote: Specialization is for insects.
quotes.author: Robert Heinlein

quotes.quote: The greatest ability in business is to get along with others and to influence their actions.
quotes.author: John Hancock

quotes.quote: I don’t pay good wages because I have a lot of money; I have a lot of money because I pay good wages.
quotes.author: Robert Bosch

quotes.quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
quotes.author: W. Edwards Deming

quotes.quote: The golden rule for every business man is this: Put yourself in your customer's place.
quotes.author: Orison Swett Marden

quotes.quote: Make the workmanship surpass the materials.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: The competitor to be feared is one who never bothers about you at all but goes on making his own business better all the time.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: You can’t expect to meet the challenges of today with yesterday’s tools and expect to be in business tomorrow.
quotes.author: Raina Chapman

quotes.quote: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
quotes.author: Bill Gates

quotes.quote: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: It is an immutable law in business that words are words, explanations are explanations, promises are promises but only performance is reality.
quotes.author: Harold Geneen

quotes.quote: Good business leaders create a vision, articulate the vision, passionately own the vision, and relentlessly drive it to completion.
quotes.author: Jack Welch

quotes.quote: In business the man who engages in the most adventures is surest to come out unhurt.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: If you don't do it excellently, don't do it at all. Because if it's not excellent, it won't be profitable or fun, and if you're not in business for fun or profit, what the hell are you doing there?
quotes.author: Robert Townsend

quotes.quote: It is difficult, but not impossible, to conduct strictly honest business.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: The purpose of business is to create and keep a customer.
quotes.author: Peter F Drucker

quotes.quote: Do what you love to do and give it your very best. Whether it's business or baseball, or the theater, or any field. If you don't love what you're doing and you can't give it your best, get out of it. Life is too short. You'll be an old man before you know it.
quotes.author: Al Lopez

quotes.quote: A business like an automobile, has to be driven, in order to get results.
quotes.author: BC Forbes

quotes.quote: Whenever you see a successful business, someone once made a courageous decision.
quotes.author: Peter F Drucker

quotes.quote: The success combination in business is: Do what you do better... and: do more of what you do.
quotes.author: David Joseph Schwartz

quotes.quote: Objectives are not fate; they are direction. They are not commands; they are commitments. They do not determine the future; they are means to mobilize the resources and energies of the business for the making of the future.
quotes.author: Peter F Drucker

quotes.quote: To succeed in business it is necessary to make others see things as you see them.
quotes.author: John H Patterson

quotes.quote: Wealth is like sea-water; the more we drink, the thirstier we become; and the same is true of fame.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: A businessman is a hybrid of a dancer and a calculator.
quotes.author: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: It is unfortunate we can’t buy many business executives for what they are worth and sell them for what they think they are worth.
quotes.author: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: If you had to identify, in one word, the reason why the human race has not achieved, and never will achieve, its full potential, that word would be meetings.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: Advertising is legalized lying.
quotes.author: H.G. Wells

quotes.quote: The superior man understands what is right; the inferior man understands what will sell.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote: A man of business may talk of philosophy; a man who has none may practice it.
quotes.author: Alexander Pope

quotes.quote: There's no luck in business. There's only drive, determination, and more drive.
quotes.author: Sophie Kinsella

quotes.quote: Business is a game, played for fantastic stakes, and you're in competition with experts. If you want to win, you have to learn to be a master of the game.
quotes.author: Sidney Sheldon

quotes.quote: I insist on a lot of time being spent, almost every day, to just sit and think. That is very uncommon in American business. I read and think. So I do more reading and thinking, and make less impulse decisions than most people in business. I do it because I like this kind of life.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote: The results of quality work last longer than the shock of high prices.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Business, you know, may bring money, but friendship hardly ever does.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: A business has to be involving, it has to be fun, and it has to exercise your creative instincts.
quotes.author: Richard Branson

quotes.quote: When developing and designing products that invite people to use them, just do it right from the start and put your heart into it. It’s harder and it takes longer, but everyone wins in the end.
quotes.author: Michael D. Harris

quotes.quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you’re not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
quotes.author: David Rockefeller

quotes.quote: Entrepreneurs average 3.8 failures before final success. What sets the successful ones apart is their amazing persistence.
quotes.author: Lisa M. Amos

quotes.quote: Always back the horse named self-interest, son. It'll be the only one trying.
quotes.author: Jack Lang

quotes.quote: A man may be a tough, concentrated, successful money-maker and never contribute to his country anything more than a horrible example.
quotes.author: Robert Menzies

quotes.quote: In the business world, everyone is paid in two coins: cash and experience. Take the experience first; the cash will come later.
quotes.author: Harold Geneen

quotes.quote: Business is a combination of war and sport.
quotes.author: André Maurois

quotes.quote: The absolute fundamental aim is to make money out of satisfying customers.
quotes.author: John Egan

quotes.quote: Corporation: An ingenious device for obtaining profit without individual responsibility.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: It is not the employer who pays the wages. He only handles the money. It is the product that pays the wages.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Experience taught me a few things. One is to listen to your gut, no matter how good something sounds on paper. The second is that you’re generally better off sticking with what you know. And the third is that sometimes your best investments are the ones you don’t make.
quotes.author: Donald Trump

quotes.quote: The entrepreneur in us sees opportunities everywhere we look, but many people see only problems everywhere they look.
quotes.author: Michael Gerber

quotes.quote: Be fearful when others are greedy. Be greedy when others are fearful.
quotes.author: Warren Buffet

quotes.quote: There is a tide in the affairs of men which, taken at the flood, leads on to fortune;
quotes.author: Shakespeare

quotes.quote: There ain't no such thing as a free lunch.
quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

quotes.quote: It is no crime to be ignorant of economics, which is, after all, a specialized discipline and one that most people consider to be a ‘dismal science.’ But it is totally irresponsible to have a loud and vociferous opinion on economic subjects while remaining in this state of ignorance.
quotes.author: Murray N. Rothbard

quotes.quote: There’s class warfare, all right, but it’s my class, the rich class, that’s making war, and we’re winning.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote: If you are rich, you have to be an idiot not to stay rich. And if you are poor, you have to be really smart to get rich.
quotes.author: John Green

quotes.quote: We have always known that heedless self-interest was bad morals, we now know that it is bad economics.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: If you owe your bank a hundred pounds, you have a problem. But if you owe a million, it has.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: The United States spends over $87 billion conducting a war in Iraq while the United Nations estimates that for less than half that amount we could provide clean water, adequate diets, sanitations services and basic education to every person on the planet. And we wonder why terrorists attack us.
quotes.author: John Perkins

quotes.quote: People were poor not because they were stupid or lazy. They worked all day long, doing complex physical tasks. They were poor because the financial institution in the country did not help them widen their economic base.
quotes.author: Muhammad Yunus

quotes.quote: 1 billion people in the world are chronically hungry. 1 billion people are overweight.
quotes.author: Mark Bittman

quotes.quote: Economics was like psychology, a pseudoscience trying to hide that fact with intense theoretical hyperelaboration.
quotes.author: Kim Stanley Robinson

quotes.quote: Just as a poetic discussion of the weather is not meteorology, so an issuance of moral pronouncements or political creeds about the economy is not economics. Economics is a study of cause-and-effect relationships in an economy.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.quote: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: There is never enough of anything to satisfy all those who want it. The first lesson of politics is to disregard the first lesson of economics.
quotes.author: Thomas Sowell

quotes.quote: Economics is the painful elaboration of the obvious.
quotes.author: Friedrich von Hayek

quotes.quote: The curious task of economics is to demonstrate to men how little they really know about what they imagine they can design.
quotes.author: Friedrich von Hayek

quotes.quote: I can’t imagine economists admitting how little they actually know. If they admitted to themselves, it would hurt their ego. If they admitted to others, it would hurt their job prospects.
quotes.author: Joseph Mattes

quotes.quote: The use of mathematics has brought rigor to economics. Unfortunately, it has also brought mortis.
quotes.author: Robert Heilbroner

quotes.quote: A study of economics usually reveals that the best time to buy anything is last year.
quotes.author: Marty Allen

quotes.quote: Economic statistics are like a bikini, what they reveal is important, what they conceal is vital.
quotes.author: Professor Sir Frank Holmes

quotes.quote: Doing econometrics is like trying to learn the laws of electricity by playing the radio.
quotes.author: Guy Orcutt

quotes.quote: The First Law of Economists: For every economist, there exists an equal and opposite economist. The Second Law of Economists: They’re both wrong.
quotes.author: David Wildasin

quotes.quote: An economist is someone who, when he finds something that works in practice, tries to make it work in theory.
quotes.author: Walter Heller

quotes.quote: The purpose of studying economics is not to acquire a set of ready-made answers to economic questions, but to learn how to avoid being deceived by economists.
quotes.author: Joan Violet Robinson

quotes.quote: An economist is an expert who will know tomorrow why the things he predicted yesterday didn’t happen today.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: Economics is the only field in which two people can get a Nobel Prize for saying exactly the opposite thing.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: When an economist says the evidence is “mixed,” he or she means that theory says one thing and data says the opposite.
quotes.author: Richard Thaler

quotes.quote: Inflation is the one form of taxation that can be imposed without legislation.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: I don’t think you can spend yourself rich.
quotes.author: George Humphrey

quotes.quote: A major source of objection to a free economy is precisely that it … gives people what they want instead of what a particular group thinks they ought to want. Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: The most important single central fact about a free market is that no exchange takes place unless both parties benefit.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: The only thing worse than being exploited by capitalism is not being exploited by capitalism.
quotes.author: Joan Violet Robinson

quotes.quote: If an exchange between two parties is voluntary, it will not take place unless both believe they will benefit from it. Most economic fallacies derive from the neglect of this simple insight, from the tendency to assume that there is a fixed pie that one party can only gain at the expense of another.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: It is because it’s prohibited. See, if you look at the drug war from a purely economic point of view, the role of the government is to protect the drug cartel. That’s literally true.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: All models are wrong but some are useful.
quotes.author: George Box

quotes.quote: I’d rather be vaguely right than precisely wrong.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: There is an entirely leisure class located at both ends of the economic spectrum.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: An economist is a man who states the obvious in terms of the incomprehensible.
quotes.author: Alfred A. Knopf

quotes.quote: There can be no real individual freedom in the presence of economic insecurity.
quotes.author: Chester Bowles

quotes.quote: If all economists were laid end to end, they would not reach a conclusion.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Economics is extremely useful as a form of employment for economists.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: Isn't it interesting that the same people who laugh at science fiction listen to weather forecasts and economists?
quotes.author: RAJ Phillips

quotes.quote: As a scholarly discipline, economics has always suffered from physics envy.
quotes.author: Robert Kuttner

quotes.quote: It [economics] is a method rather than a doctrine, an apparatus of the mind, a technique of thinking which helps its possessor to draw correct conclusions.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: A society that puts equality before freedom will get neither. A society that puts freedom before equality will get a high degree of both.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: The great virtue of a free market system is that it does not care what color people are; it does not care what their religion is; it only cares whether they can produce something you want to buy. It is the most effective system we have discovered to enable people who hate one another to deal with one another and help one another.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: Many people want the government to protect the consumer. A much more urgent problem is to protect the consumer from the government.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: The long run is a misleading guide to current affairs. In the long run we are all dead.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: Capitalism is the astounding belief that the wickedest of men will do the wickedest of things for the greatest good of everyone.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: The avoidance of taxes is the only intellectual pursuit that carries any reward.
quotes.author: John Maynard Keynes

quotes.quote: When you combine ignorance and leverage, you get some pretty interesting results.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote: Every man lives by exchanging.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: What is prudence in the conduct of every private family can scarce be folly in that of a great kingdom.
quotes.author: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: When I was young, I thought that money was the most important thing in life; now that I am old, I know it is.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The easiest way to teach children the value of money is to borrow some from them.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: Don't lend people money, it gives them amnesia.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: When it’s a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Whoever said money can't buy happiness simply didn't know where to go shopping.
quotes.author: Bo Derek

quotes.quote: All riches have their origin in mind. Wealth is in ideas - not money.
quotes.author: Robert Collier

quotes.quote: Borrow money from a pessimist - they don't expect it back.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: To give real service you must add something which cannot be bought or measured with money, and that is sincerity and integrity.
quotes.author: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: It is a wise man who lives with money in the bank, it is a fool who dies that way.
quotes.author: French proverb

quotes.quote: Money will not make you happy, and happy will not make you money.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: You aren't wealthy until you have something money can't buy.
quotes.author: Garth Brooks

quotes.quote: The rich would have to eat money if the poor did not provide food.
quotes.author: Russian proverb

quotes.quote: Don't tell me where your priorities are. Show me where you spend your money and I'll tell you what they are.
quotes.author: James W Frick

quotes.quote: When I chased after money, I never had enough. When I got my life on purpose and focused on giving of myself and everything that arrived into my life, then I was prosperous.
quotes.author: Wayne Dwyer

quotes.quote: You have not lived a perfect day, even though you have earned your money, unless you have done something for someone who will never be able to repay you.
quotes.author: Ruth Smeltzer

quotes.quote: If you want to feel rich, just count the things you have that money can't buy.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: Some people think they are worth a lot of money just because they have it.
quotes.author: Fannie Hurst

quotes.quote: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Money never made a man happy yet, nor will it. The more a man has, the more he wants. Instead of filling a vacuum, it makes one.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Every sale has five basic obstacles: no need, no money, no hurry, no desire, no trust.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: Money without brains is always dangerous.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: Money never starts an idea. It is always the idea that starts the money.
quotes.author: Owen Laughlin

quotes.quote: Being rich is having money; being wealthy is having time.
quotes.author: Margaret Bonnano

quotes.quote: The rich man is always sold to the institution which makes him rich. Absolutely speaking, the more money, the less virtue.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The art is not in making money, but in keeping it.
quotes.author: Proverb

quotes.quote: The safe way to double your money is to fold it over once and put it in your pocket.
quotes.author: Kin Hubbard

quotes.quote: Money often costs too much.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I'd like to live as a poor man with lots of money.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: Money is like love; it kills slowly and painfully the one who withholds it and enlivens the other who turns it on his fellow man.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Blood's not thicker than money.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Money can't buy friends, but it can get you a better class of enemy.
quotes.author: Spike Milligan

quotes.quote: I think the person who takes a job in order to live - that is to say, for the money - has turned himself into a slave.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: The use of money is all the advantage there is in having it.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

quotes.quote: So you think that money is the root of all evil. Have you ever asked what is the root of all money?
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: Cocaine is God's way of saying you're making too much money.
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: While money can't buy happiness, it certainly lets you choose your own form of misery.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: I don't pay good wages because I have a lot of money; I have a lot of money because I pay good wages.
quotes.author: Robert Bosch

quotes.quote: Don't marry for money; you can borrow it cheaper.
quotes.author: Scottish proverb

quotes.quote: Most people work just hard enough not to get fired and get paid just enough money not to quit.
quotes.author: George Carlin

quotes.quote: Money, it turned out, was exactly like sex, you thought of nothing else if you didn't have it and thought of other things if you did.
quotes.author: James Arthur Baldwin

quotes.quote: When money speaks, the truth is silent.
quotes.author: Russian proverb

quotes.quote: Money, if it does not bring you happiness, will at least help you be miserable in comfort.
quotes.author: Helen Gurley Brown

quotes.quote: Money doesn't talk, it swears.
quotes.author: Bob Dylan

quotes.quote: I've got all the money I'll ever need; if I die by four O'clock.
quotes.author: Henry Youngman

quotes.quote: Government always finds a need for whatever money it gets.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Successful people make money. It's not that people who make money become successful, but that successful people attract money. They bring success to what they do.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: A fool and his money are soon elected.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Money is related to class only in the minds of people who have too much of the former, too little of the latter or none of either.
quotes.author: Doug Robarchek

quotes.quote: Why is it inflationary if the people keep their own money, and spend it the way they want to, [but] not inflationary if the government takes it and spends it the way it wants to?
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: You are always a valuable, worthwhile human being -- not because anybody says so, not because you're successful, not because you make a lot of money -- but because you decide to believe it and for no other reason.
quotes.author: William Dyer

quotes.quote: Lend money to an enemy, and thou will gain him, to a friend and thou will lose him.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Money isn't everything - but it's a long way ahead of what comes next.
quotes.author: Edmund Stockdale

quotes.quote: Money is not required to buy one necessity of the soul.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Rule No.1: Never lose money. Rule No.2: Never forget rule No.1.
quotes.author: Warren Buffet

quotes.quote: If you want to see what God thinks of money, just look at all the people He gave it to.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote: Advertising is the art of convincing people to spend money they don't have for something they don't need.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Money, not morality, is the principle of commerce and commercial nations.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Money will come when you are doing the right thing.
quotes.author: Mike Phillips

quotes.quote: Knowledge is like money: the more one gets, the more one craves.
quotes.author: John Billings

quotes.quote: Three groups spend other people's money: children, thieves, politicians. All three need supervision.
quotes.author: Dick Armey

quotes.quote: I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The lack of money is the root of all evil.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: No one in this world has ever lost money by underestimating the intelligence of the great masses of the plain people. Nor has anyone ever lost public office thereby.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: Run for your life from any man who tells you that money is evil. That sentence is the leper’s bell of an approaching looter.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: One difference between a liberal and a pickpocket is that if you demand your money back from a pickpocket, he won't question your motives.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
quotes.author: Bob Hope

quotes.quote: I wish I had a dollar for every time I spent a dollar, because then, Yahoo!, I'd have all my money back.
quotes.author: Jack Handy

quotes.quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
quotes.author: WC Fields

quotes.quote: Money won't make you happy... but everybody wants to find out for themselves.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: I hope that after I die, people will say of me: "That guy sure owed me a lot of money”.
quotes.author: Jack Handy

quotes.quote: It will be a great day when our schools have all the money they need, and our air force has to have a bake-sale to buy a bomber.
quotes.author: Robert Fulghum

quotes.quote: Money is neither my god nor my devil. It is a form of energy that tends to make us more of who we already are, whether it's greedy or loving.
quotes.author: Dan Millman

quotes.quote: The best way to help the poor is not to become one of them.
quotes.author: Lang Hancock

quotes.quote: Love lasteth long as the money endureth.
quotes.author: William Caxton

quotes.quote: I don't tell jokes, I just look at government and report the facts.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Strange women lying in ponds distributing swords is no basis for a system of government!
quotes.author: Monty Python

quotes.quote: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.
quotes.author: Milton Friedman

quotes.quote: Government is the people's business and every man, woman and child becomes a shareholder with the first penny of tax paid.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: We have the best government that money can buy.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Sometimes I wonder whether the world is being run by smart people who are putting us on or by imbeciles who really mean it.
quotes.author: Laurence J. Peter

quotes.quote: You can't give the government the power to do good without also giving it the power to do bad - in fact, to do anything it wants.
quotes.author: Harry Browne

quotes.quote: All government is an ugly necessity.
quotes.author: GK Chesterton

quotes.quote: The heaviest penalty for declining to rule is to be ruled by someone inferior to yourself.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: It is dangerous to be right when the government is wrong.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: The art of government is to make two-thirds of a nation pay all it possibly can pay for the benefit of the other third.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: War is when the government tells you who the bad guy is. Revolution is when you decide that for yourself.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: It is not the function of our Government to keep the citizen from falling into error; it is the function of the citizen to keep the Government from falling into error.
quotes.author: Robert H Jackson

quotes.quote: The problem with socialism is that you eventually run out of other people's money.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.quote: The best government is a benevolent tyranny tempered by an occasional assassination.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: I was ecstatic they re-named 'French Fries' as 'Freedom Fries'. Grown men and women in positions of power in the U.S. government showing themselves as idiots.
quotes.author: Johnny Depp

quotes.quote: The government is us; we are the government, you and I.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: It's easy being a humorist when you've got the whole government working for you.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: The most dangerous man to any government is the man who is able to think things out for himself, without regard to the prevailing superstitions and taboos. Almost inevitably he comes to the conclusion that the government he lives under is dishonest, insane, and intolerable.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: I am sometimes a fox and sometimes a lion. The whole secret of government lies in knowing when to be the one or the other.
quotes.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: The greatest patriotism is to tell your country when it is behaving dishonorably, foolishly, viciously.
quotes.author: Julian Barnes

quotes.quote: The worst government is the most moral. One composed of cynics is often very tolerant and humane. But when fanatics are on top there is no limit to oppression.
quotes.author: Henry Louis Mencken

quotes.quote: Government does not solve problems; it subsidizes them.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: When they call the roll in the Senate, the Senators do not know whether to answer 'Present' or 'Not Guilty'.
quotes.author: Theodore Roosevelt

quotes.quote: The primary function of the government is - and here I am quoting directly from the U.S. Constitution - "to spew out paper”.
quotes.author: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: One way to make sure crime doesn't pay would be to let the government run it.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Nothing is more surprising than the easiness with which the many are governed by the few.
quotes.author: David Hume

quotes.quote: Freedom is the recognition that no single person, no single authority or government has a monopoly on the truth, but that every individual life is infinitely precious, that every one of us put in this world has been put there for a reason and has something to offer.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: The state is that great fiction by which everyone tries to live at the expense of everyone else.
quotes.author: Frédéric Bastiat

quotes.quote: Which is the best government? That which teaches us to govern ourselves.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: A little rebellion now and then... is a medicine necessary for the sound health of government.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I want the US government to dispense with all the “red tape,” and start using Caution tape.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.quote: Can America get back to a point where politicians are honest? Not unless that point is the tip of a sword.
quotes.author: Jarod Kintz

quotes.quote: We must not look to government to solve our problems. Government is the problem.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil; in its worst state, an intolerable one.
quotes.author: Thomas Paine

quotes.quote: Empires do not suffer emptiness of purpose at the time of their creation. It is when they have become established that aims are lost and replaced by vague ritual.
quotes.author: Frank Herbert

quotes.quote: Inflation is like sin; every government denounces it and every government practices it.
quotes.author: Frederick Leith-Ross

quotes.quote: I consider trial by jury as the only anchor ever yet imagined by man, by which a government can be held to the principles of its constitution.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Were it left to me to decide whether we should have a government without newspapers or newspapers without government, I should not hesitate a moment to prefer the latter.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: When one gets in bed with government, one must expect the diseases it spreads.
quotes.author: Ron Paul

quotes.quote: Public servants say, always with the best of intentions, "What greater service we could render if only we had a little more money and a little more power." But the truth is that outside of its legitimate function, government does nothing as well or as economically as the private sector.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: Good government is no substitute for self-government.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: I believe there is something out there watching us. Unfortunately, it's the government.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: The universe never did make sense; I suspect it was built on government contract.
quotes.author: Robert A Heinlein

quotes.quote: We must not confuse dissent with disloyalty. When the loyal opposition dies, I think the soul of America dies with it.
quotes.author: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: Liberty has never come from Government. Liberty has always come from the subjects of it... The history of liberty is a history of limitations of governmental power, not the increase of it.
quotes.author: Woodrow T Wilson

quotes.quote: The strongest reason for the people to retain the right to bear arms is, as a last resort, to protect themselves against tyranny in government.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Writing laws is easy, but governing is difficult.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: I think people need to be educated to the fact that marijuana is not a drug. Marijuana is an herb and a flower. God put it here. If He put it here and He wants it to grow, what gives the government the right to say that God is wrong?
quotes.author: Willie Nelson

quotes.quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: We are imperfect. We cannot expect perfect government.
quotes.author: William Howard Taft

quotes.quote: Today, if you invent a better mousetrap, the government comes along with a better mouse.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: In the absence of justice, what is sovereignty but organized robbery?
quotes.author: St. Augustine

quotes.quote: That government is best which governs the least, because its people discipline themselves.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Giving money and power to government is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys.
quotes.author: P.J. O'Rourke

quotes.quote: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: The amount of time required to complete a government project is precisely equal to the length of time already spent on it.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Any people anywhere, being inclined and having the power, have the right to rise up, and shake off the existing government, and form a new one that suits them better. This is a most valuable - a most sacred right - a right, which we hope and believe, is to liberate the world.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Government is an association of men who do violence to the rest of us.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: Congress is so strange. A man gets up to speak and says nothing. Nobody listens — and then everybody disagrees.
quotes.author: Boris Marshalov

quotes.quote: A great revolution is never the fault of the people, but of the government.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Ask not what the government can do for you. Ask why it doesn't.
quotes.author: Gerhard Kocher

quotes.quote: Talk is cheap — except when Congress does it.
quotes.author: Cullen Hightower

quotes.quote: A government is the most dangerous threat to man's rights: it holds a legal monopoly on the use of physical force against legally disarmed victims.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: History shows that when the taxes of a nation approach about 20% of the people's income, there begins to be a lack of respect for government. . . When it reaches 25%, there comes an increase in lawlessness.
quotes.author: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: The Constitution is not an instrument for the government to restrain the people, it is an instrument for the people to restrain the government - lest it come to dominate our lives and interests.
quotes.author: Patrick Henry

quotes.quote: Government is not reason, it is not eloquence, it is force; like fire, a troublesome servant and a fearful master. Never for a moment should it be left to irresponsible action.
quotes.author: George Washington
