quotes.quote: When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what world calls a romance.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: To a woman in love, loving too much is not loving enough.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: If you have to think about whether you love someone or not then the answer is no. When you love someone you just know.
quotes.author: Janice Markowitz

quotes.quote: Love begins with a smile, grows with a kiss, and ends with a teardrop.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.quote: The perfect love affair is one which is conducted entirely by post.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: The more I give to thee, the more I have, for both are infinite.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Love is as much of an object as an obsession, everybody wants it, everybody seeks it, but few ever achieve it, those who do will cherish it, be lost in it, and among all, never... never forget it.
quotes.author: Curtis Judalet

quotes.quote: Pleasure of love lasts but a moment, Pain of love lasts a lifetime.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: My wife Mary and I have been married for forty-seven years and not once have we had an argument serious enough to consider divorce; murder, yes, but divorce, never.
quotes.author: Jack Benny

quotes.quote: Nice people don't necessarily fall in love with nice people.
quotes.author: Jonathan Franzen

quotes.quote: So many persons think divorce a panacea for every ill, who find out, when they try it, that the remedy is worse than the disease.
quotes.author: Dorothy Dix

quotes.quote: Divorce isn't such a tragedy. A tragedy's staying in an unhappy marriage, teaching your children the wrong things about love. Nobody ever died of divorce.
quotes.author: Jennifer Weiner

quotes.quote: Divorce begins with too many unspoken words and things at the end of the day.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Such silence has an actual sound, the sound of disappearance.
quotes.author: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.quote: In every marriage more than a week old, there are grounds for divorce. The trick is to find, and continue to find, grounds for marriage.
quotes.author: Robert Anderson

quotes.quote: If you spend your time hoping someone will suffer the consequences for what they did to your heart, then you're allowing them to hurt you a second time in your mind.
quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

quotes.quote: I maintain that it should cost as much to get married as to get divorced. Make it look like marriage is worth as much as divorce, even if it ain't.
quotes.author: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: Your relationship may be "Breaking Up," but you won't be "Breaking Down." If anything you’re correcting a mistake that was hurting four people, you and the person you’re with, not to mention the two people who you were destined to meet.
quotes.author: D. Ivan Young

quotes.quote: There are two sides to every divorce: Yours and shithead's.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Hollywood brides keep the bouquets and throw away the grooms.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: Ah, yes, divorce ... from the Latin word meaning to rip out a man's genitals through his wallet.
quotes.author: Robin Williams

quotes.quote: Paying alimony is like feeding hay to a dead horse.
quotes.author: Groucho Marx

quotes.quote: My divorce came to me as a complete surprise. That's what happens when you haven't been home in eighteen years.
quotes.author: Lee Trevino

quotes.quote: Delusion detests focus and romance provides the veil.
quotes.author: Suzanne Finnamore

quotes.quote: Insanity: grounds for divorce in some states, grounds for marriage in all.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Grief is the emotional contract of divorce.
quotes.author: Cheryl Nielsen

quotes.quote: Many married couples separate because they quarrel incessantly, but just as many separate because they were never honest enough or courageous enough to quarrel when they should have.
quotes.author: Sydney J. Harris

quotes.quote: Love is grand; divorce is a hundred grand.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Divorce is a fire exit. When a house is burning, it doesn’t matter who set the fire. If there is no fire exit, everyone in the house will be burned!
quotes.author: Mehmet Murat lldan

quotes.quote: When two people decide to get a divorce, it isn't a sign that they "don't understand" one another, but a sign that they have, at last, begun to.
quotes.author: Helen Rowland

quotes.quote: Losing a mate to death is devastating but it's not a personal attack like divorce. When somebody you love stops loving you and walks away, it's an insult beyond comparison.
quotes.author: Sue Merrell

quotes.quote: An unresolved issue will be like a cancer with the potential to spread into other areas of your relationship, eroding the joy, lightness, love and beauty.
quotes.author: Joyce Vissell

quotes.quote: I'm an excellent housekeeper. Every time I get a divorce, I keep the house.
quotes.author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quotes.quote: I don’t miss him, I miss who I thought he was.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: The happiest time in any man's life is just after the first divorce.
quotes.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.quote: She cried—and the judge wiped her tears with my checkbook.
quotes.author: Tommy Manville

quotes.quote: Divorced men are more likely to meet their car payments than their child support obligations.
quotes.author: Susan Faludi

quotes.quote: My mother always said don't marry for money, divorce for money.
quotes.author: Wendy Liebman

quotes.quote: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: To the world you may be just one person, but to one person you may be the world.
quotes.author: Brandi Snyder

quotes.quote: Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . ."
quotes.author: CS Lewis

quotes.quote: Even though we've changed and we're all finding our own place in the world, we all know that when the tears fall or the smile spreads across our face, we'll come to each other because no matter where this crazy world takes us, nothing will ever change so much to the point where we're not all still friends.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: If you live to be 100, I hope I live to be 100 minus 1 day, so I never have to live without you.
quotes.author: AA Milne

quotes.quote: The truth is, everyone is going to hurt you. You just got to find the ones worth suffering for.
quotes.author: Bob Marley

quotes.quote: What is uttered from the heart alone will win the hearts of others to your own.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Truly great friends are hard to find, difficult to leave, and impossible to forget.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Piglet sidled up to Pooh from behind. "Pooh?" he whispered. "Yes, Piglet?" "Nothing," said Piglet, taking Pooh's hand. "I just wanted to be sure of you.”
quotes.author: AA Milne

quotes.quote: Love is when two people know everything about each other and are still friends.
quotes.author: Mary Oliver

quotes.quote: Keep away from those who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you believe that you too can become great.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: There is nothing I would not do for those who are really my friends. I have no notion of loving people by halves, it is not my nature.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate.
quotes.author: Linda Grayson

quotes.quote: True friends stab you in the front.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
quotes.author: Marlene Dietrich

quotes.quote: A true friend is someone who thinks that you are a good egg even though he knows that you are slightly cracked.
quotes.author: Bernard Meltzer

quotes.quote: Life is an awful, ugly place to not have a best friend.
quotes.author: Sarah Dessen

quotes.quote: I would rather walk with a friend in the dark, than alone in the light.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival.
quotes.author: CS Lewis

quotes.quote: Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
quotes.author: Muhammad Ali

quotes.quote: True friendship comes when the silence between two people is comfortable.
quotes.author: David Tyson Gentry

quotes.quote: Only a true best friend can protect you from your immortal enemies.
quotes.author: Richelle Mead

quotes.quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
quotes.author: Henri Nouwen

quotes.quote: There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.
quotes.author: Irving Stone

quotes.quote: The difference between friendship and love is how much you can hurt each other.
quotes.author: Ashleigh Brilliant

quotes.quote: Men kick friendship around like a football but it doesn't seem to break. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
quotes.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quotes.quote: Words are easy, like the wind; Faithful friends are hard to find.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
quotes.author: Khalil Gibran

quotes.quote: Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.
quotes.author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quotes.quote: We all take different paths in life, but no matter where we go, we take a little of each other everywhere.
quotes.author: Tim McGraw

quotes.quote: Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.
quotes.author: Ally Condie

quotes.quote: Friendship is like a glass ornament, once it is broken it can rarely be put back together exactly the same way.
quotes.author: Charles Kingsley

quotes.quote: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.
quotes.author: Charles Lamb

quotes.quote: The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.
quotes.author: Jay McInerney

quotes.quote: In prosperity, our friends know us; in adversity, we know our friends.
quotes.author: John Churton Collins

quotes.quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
quotes.author: Bette Midler

quotes.quote: The most beautiful discovery true friends make is that they can grow separately without growing apart.
quotes.author: Elisabeth Foley

quotes.quote: But what is the good of friendship if one cannot say exactly what one means? Anybody can say charming things and try to please and to flatter, but a true friend always says unpleasant things, and does not mind giving pain. Indeed, if he is a really true friend he prefers it, for he knows that then he is doing good.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: If you have good friends, no matter how much life is sucking, they can make you laugh.
quotes.author: P.C. Cast

quotes.quote: Friends are God's way of taking care of us.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.
quotes.author: Elie Wiesel

quotes.quote: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
quotes.author: Charles R Swindoll

quotes.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.
quotes.author: Markus Zusak

quotes.quote: Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.
quotes.author: Stieg Larsson

quotes.quote: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
quotes.author: Plutarch

quotes.quote: You can go through life and make new friends every year - every month practically - but there was never any substitute for those friendships of childhood that survive into adult years. Those are the ones in which we are bound to one another with hoops of steel.
quotes.author: Alexander McCall Smith

quotes.quote: You find out who your real friends are when you're involved in a scandal.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Taylor

quotes.quote: I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.
quotes.author: J.D. Salinger

quotes.quote: A true friend is one who knows all about you and likes you anyway.
quotes.author: Christi Mary Warner

quotes.quote: Anybody can sympathise with the sufferings of a friend, but it requires a very fine nature to sympathise with a friend's success.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: The best mirror is an old friend.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.quote: When someone tells you the truth, lets you think for yourself, experience your own emotions, he is treating you as a true equal. As a friend.
quotes.author: Whitney Otto

quotes.quote: Why are old lovers able to become friends? Two reasons. They never truly loved each other, or they love each other still.
quotes.author: Whitney Otto

quotes.quote: A friend is someone who helps you up when you're down, and if they can't, they lay down beside you and listen.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: And if your friend does evil to you, say to him, ''I forgive you for what you did to me, but how can I forgive you for what you did to yourself?”
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Are you upset little friend? Have you been lying awake worrying? Well, don't worry...I'm here. The flood waters will recede, the famine will end, the sun will shine tomorrow, and I will always be here to take care of you.
quotes.author: Charles M Schulz

quotes.quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
quotes.author: Woodrow T. Wilson

quotes.quote: A good friend will pick you back up when you fall but your best friend will laugh and trip you again.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Friends are the sunshine of life.
quotes.author: John Hay

quotes.quote: Friends are like good bras: supportive, hard to find, and close to your heart.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Don’t walk in front of me; I may not follow. Don’t walk behind me; I may not lead. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Friendship consists in forgetting what one gives and remembering what one receives.
quotes.author: Alexander Dumas

quotes.quote: The best kind of friend is the kind you can sit on a porch swing with, never say a word, then walk away feeling like it was the best conversation that you ever had.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm & constant.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Friendship is like money, easier made than kept.
quotes.author: Samuel Butler

quotes.quote: A friend is someone who knows the song in your heart and can sing it back to you when you have forgotten the words.
quotes.author: CS Lewis

quotes.quote: He who does something at the head of one regiment, will eclipse him who does nothing at the head of a hundred.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Those who believe that they are exclusively in the right are generally those who achieve something.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Concentrate all of your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun’s rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
quotes.author: Alexander Graham Bell

quotes.quote: Give me but one firm spot on which to stand and I will move the Earth.
quotes.author: Archimedes

quotes.quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see.
quotes.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.quote: For myself, losing is not coming second. It’s getting out of the water knowing you could have done better.
quotes.author: Ian Thorpe

quotes.quote: To gain that which is worth having, it may be necessary to lose everything else.
quotes.author: Bernadette Devlin McAliskey

quotes.quote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: It’s the stuff of dreams … Kids from Kilburn don’t become favourite for the Tour de France. You’re supposed to become a postman or a milkman or work in Ladbrokes.
quotes.author: Bradley Wiggins

quotes.quote: The fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Diligence is the mother of good fortune, and idleness, its opposite, never led to good intention’s goal.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: The world is divided into people who do things and people who get the credit. Try, if you can, to belong to the first class. There’s far less competition.
quotes.author: Dwight Morrow

quotes.quote: The two kinds of people on earth I mean are the people who lift, and the people who lean.
quotes.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quotes.quote: I attribute my success to this — I never gave or took any excuse.
quotes.author: Florence Nightingale

quotes.quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Success is more dangerous than failure, the ripples break over a wider coastline.
quotes.author: Graham Greene

quotes.quote: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Not in the clamour of the crowded street, not in the shouts and plaudits of the throng, but in ourselves, are triumph and defeat.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: Fame is no plant that grows on mortal soil.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: All the world’s great have been little boys who wanted the moon.
quotes.author: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: Whether our efforts are, or not, favoured by life, let us be able to say when we come near the great goal, “I have done what I could”.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.quote: To live at all is miracle enough.
quotes.author: Mervyn Peake

quotes.quote: In most things success depends on knowing how long it takes to succeed.
quotes.author: Montesquieu

quotes.quote: The reward of a thing well done is to have done it.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The love of life is necessary to the vigorous prosecution of any undertaking.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: I had done all that I could; and no man is well pleased to have his all neglected, be it ever so little.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves.
quotes.author: Sir Edmund Hillary

quotes.quote: We may become the makers of our fate when we have ceased to pose as its prophets.
quotes.author: Sir Karl Popper

quotes.quote: All men who have turned out worth anything have had the chief hand in their own education.
quotes.author: Sir Walter Scott

quotes.quote:
My mountain did not seem to me a lifeless thing of rock and ice, but warm and friendly and living.
She was a mother hen, and the other mountains were chicks under her wings.
quotes.author: Tenzing Norgay

quotes.quote: Many of life’s failures are people who did not realise how close they were to success when they gave up.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration, ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.quote: It is sobering to consider that when Mozart was my age he had already been dead for a year.
quotes.author: Tom Lehrer

quotes.quote: Success is relative: It is what we can make of the mess we have made of things.
quotes.author: TS Eliot

quotes.quote: In the United States there’s a Puritan ethic and a mythology of success. He who is successful is good. In Latin countries, in Catholic countries, a successful person is a sinner.
quotes.author: Umberto Eco

quotes.quote: I felt as if I was walking with destiny, and that all my past life had been but a preparation for this hour and this trial.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Just say the lines and don’t trip over the furniture.
quotes.author: Sir Noël Coward

quotes.quote: Television has brought back murder into the home — where it belongs.
quotes.author: Alfred Hitchcock

quotes.quote: If in the first act you have hung a pistol on the wall, then in the following one it should be fired. Otherwise don’t put it there.
quotes.author: Anton Chekhov

quotes.quote: The structure of a play is always the story of how the birds came home to roost.
quotes.author: Arthur Miller

quotes.quote: The basic essential of a great actor is that he loves himself in acting.
quotes.author: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.quote: Without wonder and insight, acting is just a trade. With it, it becomes creation.
quotes.author: Bette Davis

quotes.quote: You spend all your life trying to do something they put people in asylums for.
quotes.author: Jane Fonda

quotes.quote: Acting should be like punk in the best way. It should be a full-on expression of self – only without the broken bottles.
quotes.author: John Cusack

quotes.quote: Playing Shakespeare is very tiring. You never get to sit down, unless you’re a king.
quotes.author: Josephine Hull

quotes.quote: Acting is a masochistic form of exhibitionism. It is not quite the occupation of an adult.
quotes.author: Laurence Olivier

quotes.quote: A painter paints, a musician plays, a writer writes – but a movie actor waits.
quotes.author: Mary Astor

quotes.quote: Acting is standing up naked and turning around slowly.
quotes.author: Rosalind Russell

quotes.quote: Being another character is more interesting than being yourself.
quotes.author: Sir John Gielgud

quotes.quote: The art of acting consists in keeping people from coughing.
quotes.author: Sir Ralph Richardson

quotes.quote: Official dignity tends to increase in inverse ratio to the importance of the country in which the office is held.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: It is always easier to fight for one’s principles than to live up to them.
quotes.author: Alfred Adler

quotes.quote: Man is so made that he can only find relaxation from one kind of labour by taking up another.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: A man’s mind will very generally refuse to make itself up until it be driven and compelled by emergency.
quotes.author: Anthony Trollope

quotes.quote: I have taken great care not to laugh at human actions, not to weep at them, nor to hate them, but to understand them.
quotes.author: Baruch Spinoza

quotes.quote: Men who are unhappy, like men who sleep badly, are always proud of the fact.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: One of the symptoms of approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one’s work is terribly important, and that to take a holiday would bring all kinds of disaster.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: The pendulum of the mind oscillates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: Where we have strong emotions, we’re liable to fool ourselves.
quotes.author: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: My life is spent in a perpetual alternation between two rhythms, the rhythm of attracting people for fear I may be lonely, and the rhythm of trying to get rid of them because I know that I am bored.
quotes.author: CEM Joad

quotes.quote: Any man may be in good spirits and good temper when he’s well dressed. There ain’t much credit in that.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Every one says forgiveness is a lovely idea, until they have something to forgive.
quotes.author: CS Lewis

quotes.quote: Pleasure is a thief to business.
quotes.author: Daniel Defoe

quotes.quote: The heart of man is made to reconcile the most glaring contradictions.
quotes.author: David Hume

quotes.quote: Every time you open your wardrobe, you look at your clothes and you wonder what you are going to wear. What you are really saying is, “Who am I going to be today?”
quotes.author: Fay Weldon

quotes.quote: Everyone thinks his own burden is heavy.
quotes.author: French proverb

quotes.quote: The smyler with the knyf under the cloke.
quotes.author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quotes.quote: Our deeds determine us, as much as we determine our deeds.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Our actions are like ships which we may watch set out to sea, and not know when or with what cargo they will return to port.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: The world can only be grasped by action, not by contemplation … The hand is the cutting edge of the mind.
quotes.author: Jacob Bronowski

quotes.quote:
Only the actions of the just,
Smell sweet and blossom on their dust.
quotes.author: James Shirley

quotes.quote: It isn’t what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.
quotes.author: Jane Austen

quotes.quote: I was raised to feel that doing nothing was a sin. I had to learn to do nothing.
quotes.author: Jenny Joseph

quotes.quote: It is impossible to enjoy idling thoroughly unless one has plenty of work to do.
quotes.author: Jerome K Jerome

quotes.quote: Deeds, not words shall speak me.
quotes.author: John Fletcher

quotes.quote: Word is but wynd; leff woord and tak the dede.
quotes.author: John Lydgate

quotes.quote: The highest reward for a man’s toil is not what he gets for it but what he becomes by it.
quotes.author: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: Action is consolatory. It is the enemy of thought and the friend of flattering illusions.
quotes.author: Joseph Conrad

quotes.quote: Iron rusts from disuse, stagnant water loses its purity, and in cold weather becomes frozen; even so does inaction sap the vigour of the mind.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: Everybody, sooner or later, sits down to a banquet of consequences.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quotes.quote: The only infallible rule we know is, that the man who is always talking about being a gentleman never is one.
quotes.author: RS Surtees

quotes.quote: Everyone is more or less mad on one point.
quotes.author: Rudyard Kipling

quotes.quote: The ordinary acts we practise every day at home are of more importance to the soul than their simplicity might suggest.
quotes.author: Sir Thomas More

quotes.quote: Terror … often arises from a pervasive sense of disestablishment; that things are in the unmaking.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: Perfection is terrible, it cannot have children.
quotes.author: Sylvia Plath

quotes.quote: It is part of human nature to hate the man you have hurt.
quotes.author: Tacitus

quotes.quote: Considering how foolishly people act and how pleasantly they prattle, perhaps it would be better for the world if they talked more and did less.
quotes.author: W Somerset Maugham

quotes.quote: It is an undoubted truth, that the less one has to do, the less time one finds to do it in. One yawns, one procrastinates, one can do it when one will, and therefore one seldom does it at all.
quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

quotes.quote: Anything that is worth doing has been done frequently. Things hitherto undone should be given, I suspect, a wide berth.
quotes.author: Sir Max Beerbohm

quotes.quote: Truly, when the day of judgment comes, it will not be a question of what we have read, but what we have done.
quotes.author: Thomas á Kempis

quotes.quote: Men are rewarded and punished not for what they do, but rather for how their acts are defined. This is why men are more interested in better justifying themselves than in better behaving themselves.
quotes.author: Thomas Szasz

quotes.quote: Out of clutter, find simplicity.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There’s only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that’s your own self.
quotes.author: Aldous Huxley

quotes.quote: If you would be known, and not know, vegetate in a village; if you would know, and not be known, live in a city.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has many; not on your past misfortunes of which all men have some.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Never make a defence or apology before you be accused.
quotes.author: Charles I

quotes.quote: When environment changes, there must be a corresponding change in life.
quotes.author: Charles Lindbergh

quotes.quote: Get the advice of everybody whose advice is worth having — they are very few — and then do what you think best yourself.
quotes.author: Charles Stewart Parnell

quotes.quote: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.quote: If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: Stand a little less between me and the sun.
quotes.author: Diogenes

quotes.quote: Hope is a good breakfast but a bad supper.
quotes.author: Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: Be wisely worldly, but not worldly wise.
quotes.author: Francis Quarles

quotes.quote: Believe me! The secret of reaping the greatest fruitfulness and the greatest enjoyment from life is to live dangerously!
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Simplicity is light, carefree, neat and loving — not a self-punishing ascetic trip.
quotes.author: Gary Snyder

quotes.quote: Take care to get what you like or you will be forced to like what you get.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: We must consult our means rather than our wishes.
quotes.author: George Washington

quotes.quote: One sees great things from the valley; only small things from the peak.
quotes.author: GK Chesterton

quotes.quote: Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work.
quotes.author: Gustave Flaubert

quotes.quote: This is the precept by which I have lived: prepare for the worst; expect the best; and take what comes.
quotes.author: Hannah Arendt

quotes.quote: Up with your damned nonsense will I put twice, or perhaps once, but sometimes always, by God, never.
quotes.author: Hans Richter

quotes.quote: Live all you can: it’s a mistake not to. It doesn’t matter what you do in particular, so long as you have had your life. If you haven’t had that, what have you had?
quotes.author: Henry James

quotes.quote: Never trust the man who tells you all his troubles but keeps from you all his joys.
quotes.author: Jewish proverb

quotes.quote: Meetings are a great trap … However, they are indispensable when you don’t want to do anything.
quotes.author: JK Galbraith

quotes.quote: Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Praising all alike is praising none.
quotes.author: John Gay

quotes.quote: Nor love thy life, nor hate; but what thou liv’st live well, how long or short permit to heaven.
quotes.author: John Milton

quotes.quote: Though I am always in haste, I am never in a hurry.
quotes.author: John Wesley

quotes.quote: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
quotes.author: Jonathan Swift

quotes.quote: A thick skin is a gift from God.
quotes.author: Konrad Adenauer

quotes.quote: Civility costs nothing and buys everything.
quotes.author: Lady Mary Wortley Montagu

quotes.quote: The strongest of all warriors are these two — Time and Patience.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: If you don’t know where you are going, any road will get you there.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.quote: A proverb is one man’s wit and all men’s wisdom.
quotes.author: Lord John Russell

quotes.quote: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
quotes.author: Maori proverb

quotes.quote: The heart that gives, gathers.
quotes.author: Marianne Moore

quotes.quote: You will find it a very good practice always to verify your references, sir!
quotes.author: Martin Joseph Routh

quotes.quote: The sense of being well-dressed gives a feeling of inward tranquillity which religion is powerless to bestow.
quotes.author: Miss CF Forbes

quotes.quote: I always pass on good advice. It is the only thing to do with it. It is never of any use to oneself.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Education is what you get when you read the fine print; experience is what you get when you don’t.
quotes.author: Pete Seeger

quotes.quote: When the bee comes to your house, let her have beer; you may want to visit the bee’s house some day.
quotes.author: Proverb from the Republic of Congo

quotes.quote: There was no need to do any housework at all. After the first four years the dirt doesn’t get any worse.
quotes.author: Quentin Crisp

quotes.quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.
quotes.author: Robert Burns

quotes.quote: If you live among wolves you have to howl like a wolf.
quotes.author: Russian proverb

quotes.quote: He who is blind, dumb and deaf will live a peaceful life of a hundred years.
quotes.author: Sicilian proverb

quotes.quote: You’ve got to have two out of death, sex and jewels.
quotes.author: Sir Roy Strong

quotes.quote: Nature has given us two ears, two eyes, and but one tongue — to the end that we should hear and see more than we speak.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: There are two possible situations — one can either do this or that. My honest opinion and my friendly advice is this: do it or do not do it — you will regret both.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard

quotes.quote: Don’t speak unless you can improve on the silence.
quotes.author: Spanish proverb

quotes.quote: The shrimp that falls asleep is carried away by the current.
quotes.author: Spanish proverb

quotes.quote: Straightforwardness without civility is like a surgeon’s knife, effective but unpleasant. Candour with courtesy is helpful and admirable.
quotes.author: Sri Yukteswar Giri

quotes.quote: Shared joy is a double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow.
quotes.author: Swedish proverb

quotes.quote: Coffee should be black as hell, strong as death and sweet as love.
quotes.author: Turkish proverb

quotes.quote: Your head is not only for putting a hat on.
quotes.author: Ukrainian proverb

quotes.quote: Think like a wise man but express yourself like the common people.
quotes.author: WB Yeats

quotes.quote: Be nice to people on your way up because you’ll meet ’em on your way down.
quotes.author: Wilson Mizner

quotes.quote: Let our advance worrying become advance thinking and planning.
quotes.author: Sir Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Time for a little something.
quotes.author: AA Milne

quotes.quote: In the spring a livelier iris changes on the burnished dove; In the spring a young man’s fancy lightly turns to thoughts of love.
quotes.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: My problem lies in reconciling my gross habits with my net income.
quotes.author: Errol Flynn

quotes.quote: There is no love sincerer than the love of food.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: People say I wasted my money. I say 90 per cent went on women, fast cars and booze. The rest I wasted.
quotes.author: George Best

quotes.quote: Three glasses of wine drive away the evil spirits, but with the fourth they return.
quotes.author: German proverb

quotes.quote:
If all be true that I do think,
There are five reasons we should drink:
Good wine — a friend — or being dry —
Or lest we should be by and by —
Or any other reason why.
quotes.author: Henry Aldrich

quotes.quote: We drink one another’s healths, and spoil our own.
quotes.author: Jerome K Jerome

quotes.quote: No pleasure is worth giving up for the sake of two more years in a geriatric home in Weston-super-Mare.
quotes.author: Kingsley Amis

quotes.quote: Wine may well be considered the most healthful and most hygienic of beverages.
quotes.author: Louis Pasteur

quotes.quote: One reason why I don’t drink is because I wish to know when I am having a good time.
quotes.author: Nancy Astor

quotes.quote: Strange to see how a good dinner and feasting reconciles everybody.
quotes.author: Samuel Pepys

quotes.quote: Hath wine an oblivious power? Can it pluck out the sting from the brain? The draught might beguile for an hour, But still leaves behind it the pain.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: A well-balanced person has a drink in each hand.
quotes.author: Sir Billy Connolly

quotes.quote: Too much and too little wine. Give him none, he cannot find truth; give him too much, the same.
quotes.author: Blaise Pascal

quotes.quote: There are two things that will be believed of any man whatsoever, and one of them is that he has taken to drink.
quotes.author: Booth Tarkington

quotes.quote: I only take a drink on two occasions – when I’m thirsty and when I’m not.
quotes.author: Brendan Behan

quotes.quote: Every form of addiction is bad, no matter whether the narcotic be alcohol or morphine or idealism.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote:
Then trust me, there’s nothing like drinking
So pleasant on this side the grave;
It keeps the unhappy from thinking,
And makes e’en the valiant more brave.
quotes.author: Charles Dibdin

quotes.quote: Bring in the bottled lightning, a clean tumbler, and a corkscrew.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: We are fighting Germany, Austria and drink, and so far as I can see the greatest of these deadly foes is drink.
quotes.author: David Lloyd George

quotes.quote: I feel sorry for people who don’t drink. When they wake up in the morning, that’s the best they are going to feel all day.
quotes.author: Dean Martin

quotes.quote: One whisky is all right; two is too much; three is too few.
quotes.author: Derek Cooper

quotes.quote: Come quickly, I am tasting stars!
quotes.author: Dom Perignon

quotes.quote: An alcoholic is someone you don’t like who drinks as much as you do.
quotes.author: Dylan Thomas

quotes.quote: To eat figs off the tree in the very early morning, when they have been barely touched by the sun, is one of the exquisite pleasures of the Mediterranean.
quotes.author: Elizabeth David

quotes.quote: Great eaters of meat are in general more cruel and ferocious than other men. The English are known for their cruelty.
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: Food is an important part of a balanced diet.
quotes.author: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.quote: A cheerful look makes a dish a feast.
quotes.author: George Herbert

quotes.quote: Man cannot live by bread alone; he must have peanut butter.
quotes.author: James A Garfield

quotes.quote: I saw him even now going the way of all flesh, that is to say towards the kitchen.
quotes.author: John Webster

quotes.quote: Coffee is a cold dry food, suited to the ascetic life and sedative of lust.
quotes.author: Katib Chelebi

quotes.quote: All my life I have been a very thirsty person.
quotes.author: Keith Floyd

quotes.quote: The noblest of all dogs is the hot-dog; it feeds the hand that bites it.
quotes.author: Laurence J Peter

quotes.quote: Good mashed potato is one of the great luxuries of life and I don’t blame Elvis for eating it every night for the last year of his life.
quotes.author: Lindsey Bareham

quotes.quote: Now, gentlemen, let us do something today which the world may talk of hereafter.
quotes.author: Admiral Cuthbert Collingwood

quotes.quote: We have to do the best we can. This is our sacred human responsibility.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Come, my friends. ’Tis not too late to seek a newer world.
quotes.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quotes.quote: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts; to believe in the heroic makes heroes.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: We are not creatures of circumstance; we are creators of circumstance.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: There comes a time in a man’s life when to get where he has to go — if there are no doors or windows — he walks through a wall.
quotes.author: Bernard Malamud

quotes.quote: By prevailing over all obstacles and distractions, one may unfailingly arrive at his chosen goal or destination.
quotes.author: Christopher Columbus

quotes.quote: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: I am only one, but I am one. I cannot do everything, but I can do something. And I will not let what I cannot do interfere with what I can do.
quotes.author: Edward Everett Hale

quotes.quote: What we’re saying today is that you’re either part of the solution or you’re part of the problem.
quotes.author: Eldridge Cleaver

quotes.quote: I am here to live out loud.
quotes.author: Émile Zola

quotes.quote: Man’s main task in life is to give birth to himself, to become what he potentially is. The most important product of his effort is his own personality.
quotes.author: Erich Fromm

quotes.quote: You see things; and you say, “Why?” But I dream things that never were; and I say, “Why not?”
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Life is either a daring adventure or nothing.
quotes.author: Helen Keller

quotes.quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
quotes.author: Herman Melville

quotes.quote: Time is that wherein there is opportunity, and opportunity is that wherein there is no great time.
quotes.author: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: He who has begun has half done. Dare to be wise; begin.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: You have not lived today until you have done something for someone who can never repay you.
quotes.author: John Bunyan

quotes.quote: All this will not be finished in the first 100 days. Nor will it be finished in the first 1,000 days, nor in the life of this administration, nor even perhaps in our lifetime on this planet. But let us begin.
quotes.author: John F Kennedy

quotes.quote:
What happens to a dream deferred?
Does it dry up
Like a raisin in the sun?
quotes.author: Langston Hughes

quotes.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: Great fires erupt from tiny sparks.
quotes.author: Libyan proverb

quotes.quote: What can stop the determined heart and resolved will of man?
quotes.author: Mary Shelley

quotes.quote: Life loves to be taken by the lapel and told: I’m with you kid. Let’s go.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Here is a test to find whether your mission on earth is finished: if you’re alive, it isn’t.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: The scouts’ motto is founded on my initials, it is Be Prepared, which means, you are always to be in a state of readiness in mind and body to do your duty.
quotes.author: Robert Baden-Powell

quotes.quote: Ah, but a man’s reach should exceed his grasp, Or what’s a heaven for?
quotes.author: Robert Browning

quotes.quote: To be what we are, and to become what we are capable of becoming, is the only end of life.
quotes.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
